42872904|After having pointed out the principal factors which may affect fruit drop in Persimmon (Diospyros lotus) the Author has examined the influence of hand fertilization in varieties supplied only with hermaphrodite flowers which actually are feminine owing to sterility of the pollen. The results of the experiments have shown that in the varieties Kirakaki, Castellani, Amankaki, Trakankaki, Kuki tipo the practice of hand fertilization greatly decreases fruit drap and therefore leadts to a considerably greater yield. The same thing has not been noticed in the varieties Mageli and Costata.
42872021|The Authors signals for the first time in Italy, the rather heavy damages found on young branch of cherry-tree caused by Hemiptera Homoptera, Jassidae, Cicadella viridis. Dr. Servadei exposes the biology of the insect which in Italy has a single annual generation and describes the way of ovodeposition. Dr. Grasso investigates the anatomy and the morphology of young branches affected by the insect. A method of fight is finally suggested which properly used was able to avoid damages produced from this cause.
42872969|Premesse alcune considerazioni sull'importanza del regime termico anche in rapporto alla combinazione degli altri elementi climatici e rilevata la necessit di intraprendere, pure nel. nostro ambiente, apposite ricerche sulla intensit e qualit della luce oltre che sulla durata e periodicit dell'illuminazione per il pesco, l'A. pone in evidnza i rapporti tra il regime termico stesso e la cascola delle gemme. Espone, quindi, il programma e le resultanze delle ricerche sulla cascola preantesi nel Veronese nella forma di allevamento  di A. Carteri, caratterizzata da una favorevole illuminazione della superficie fruttificante, con notevole sviluppo delle branche laterali. I numerosi conteggi di tutte le gemme fiorifere hanno consentito di porre in evidenza che l'entit della cascola delle gemme  stata di notevole rilievo in seguito al decorso mite della prima parte dell'inverno e alle strette di freddo successive, con notevoli sbalzi di temperatura nelle 24 ore. La percentuale di cascola  variata dal 77 al 10%, a seconda delle razze. La superficie fruttificante delle  branche principali, ubicata a quote un po' pi elevate,  andata soggetta ad una cascola media minore di quella delle sottobranche. Tuttavia, la razionale disposizione e inclinazione di queste ha consentito la normale evoluzione dell'a-ntesi e dell'allegagione in un congruo numero di gemme. La minor cascola delle gemme si  avuta nelle branche principali a Est, subito seguita da quella a Ovest e a poca distanza da quella a Nord; per le sottobranche la maggior cascola si  avuta con scarti limitati e in ordine decrescente : a Sud-Ovest, a Ncrd-Est, a Sud-Est, a Ovest, a Nord-Est e ad Est. L'esame dei dati sulla cascola dei frutti nelle branche e sottobranche, nelle diverse esposizioni, ha posto in evidenza che non si sono avute differenze medie di qualche rilievo in questa forma. L'A. espone quindi i risultati delle osservazioni sui gravi danni delle gelate dal 28 al 31 marzo 1948 nella zona di Firenze, con minime termiche di  3, 8 e anche inferiori in altre localit. Sono indicati i danni agli organi fiorali nel diverso stadio dell'antesi e dell'incipiente allegagione, con i necessari esami morfo-istologici sui frutticini alterati, dei quali sono poste in evidenza alcune salienti particolarit. " indicata la percentuale di danno subita da 80 variet nell'Azienda sperimentale delle Cascine e di alcune altre nel Ravennate ed altrove. Anche per i frutticini del susino sono poste in evidenza le alterazioni. After some observations on the importance of temperature also in relation with the other elements of the climate the Author points out the necessity also in our country of undertaking for the peach tree researches on the intensity and quality of light besides on the lenght and periodicity of illumination; he then points out the connections between the temperature variations and the iprefloral falling of buds. The Author then explains the programme and the results of the experiments on prefiorai falling carried out in the country near Verona ; the training shape was that of A. Carteri which allows a very favourable exposure of the fruit bearing parts of the tree and a marked development of the lateral framework branches. Frequent countings of all the floral buds have pointed out that the degree of bud falling has been considerable owing to the mild climate during the first part of the winter and the following sudden drop in temperature with conspicuous fluctuations in temperature during the 24 hours. The percentage of falling has varied from 77% to 10% according to the various varieties. The rate of falling on the fruit bearing part of the leards appeared to be inferior than on the fruit bearing part of the lateral framwork branches; yet for the proper arrangement and inclination of these the flowering and the fruit setting could normally take place in a great number of buds. The lower degree of falling took place in the leaders of the East side, then in those of the West and then again, whith a small difference, in those of the North side. In the lateral framework branches the larger degree of falling was noticed on the South-West side; then, with small differences, on the Nortfo-East, South-East, West, North-East and East. The data regarding fruit falling in the leaders and in the lateral framework  branches, in the various exposures, permit to state that there were no marked differnces in this training shape. The Author then points out the results of the observations made on the serious injuries caused by frost from March 28 to March 31 t h 1948, when minimum temperatures of  3, 8C. occured in the country near Florence and even lower temperatures in other areas nearly (Val di Chiana, etc.). Reference is made to the injuries caused to the flowers during the stages of flowering and incipient fruit setting, with morpho-histologic analysis of the small altered fruits some of the most important characteristics of which are pointed out. Reference is also made to the degree of damage suffered by 80 varieties of peaches in the Experimental Farm of Cascine, in a few orchards near Ravenna and in other Italian orchards. The alterations of the small fruits of the plum are also reported.

42872040|After having reported the results of various foreign studies on the sterility of the J. H. Hale peach, the Author relates the results of his researches. The microscopical observation of many anthers of Hale, has shown that this variety produces a very small quantity of bad and prematurely aborted pollen. Consequently, the J. H. Hale peach is practically male sterile. The observation of F hybrids, obtained by pollination of the Hale with Mayflower, St. Anna, Eureka, and (Mayflower x Suberba) Morettini n. 1, proved the inheritance of the male sterility presented by the mother variety. The great variability of the character in the first generation, suggests that the male sterility inheritance is regulated by a complicated genetical mechanism.
42872069|The Author relates on his observations performed on two pear seedlings (Kiefjer Seedling  Winter Doyenn) grown in the Horticultural Experiment Farm of Florence. The anthers of the parent varieties are perfectly regular and produce a great quantity of good pollen, while the sporigenous tissue of the anthers of the seedlings N 17 and N 22 is abnormal and fails without producing any pollen grain. On the basis of microscopical observations, the A. states that Kieffer Seedling  Winter Doyenn N 17 and 22 are male sterile. The genetic behaviour of this character seams suggest that the observed morphological sterility might be controlled by re cessive factors.
42872075|Leaves and fruits of Eryobotria japonica L. affected by medlar-scab are examinated. The observations have been taken in Sicily and on exiccata of Lab. Crit. of Pavia. The morphological characters of the conidia of the fungus are described and sizes compared with measures found by other AA. (Cavara, Scalia, Almeida, Peglion, and Savastano). AA. conclude that the medlar-scab is caused by Fusicladium Eryobotriae Cav., according to Cavara and Almeida, not rejecting the presence of Fusicladium dendriticum and Fusicladium pirinum, like other AA. affirmed (Scalia, Peglion, Savastano). AA. intend to confirme heir hypothesis with next experiences. Gli AA. hanno esaminato campioni (foglie e frutti) di Nespolo del Giappone colpiti da ticchiolatura, raccolti in Sicilia e da exiccata del Lab. Critt. di Pavia. Hanno descritto le caratteristiche morfologiche dei conidi e hanno confrontato le dimensioni trovate con quelle riferite da altri AA. Hanno concluso che Pagente della ticchiolatura del Nespolo del Giappone  il Fusicladium Eryobotriae Cav., come sostengono Almeida e Cavara, ma non escludono che si trovino pure associate a questa specie anche il Fusicladium dendriticum e il Fusicladium pirinum. Si riservano di confermare la loro ipotesi con le prove di inoculazioni incrociate.
42872081|During a period of fifteen years experiments have been carried out by the Author to test the influence of double-working (Beurr Hardy) in Beurr Clairgeau compared to the direct grafting on quince and pear seedling. The results obtained permit to state that both as regards growth and production the favourable influence. of double-working is always observable and it appears to be accentuated when the growth of some branches on the Beurr Hardy is permitted. But it must be pointed out that Beurr Clairgeau worked directly on pear seedling has shown a greater development and has yielded higer productions begining from the eight year.
42872102|The Author states the results of the observations performed on the plain of Florence, on the fruit trees damaged by the frost during the spring of the year 1949. The A. describes the alterations noticed in the flowers and the fruits of the most important peach, plum, cherry and pear varieties. From the examination of the data collected during the observations, it has appeared that the degree of resistance to the low temperatures, diminishes progressively in the most advanced stages of the flowering, and it is considerabily influenced by the hight of the brances, on which the flowers and the small fruits are inserted, in respect of the soil level. The observations performed in zones of different topographical configuration, have put in evidence that the land contours can direct cold air drainage, causing localised damage to fruit crops.
42872991|Misurazioni dell'accrescimento radiale del legno nel pero Butirra Clairgeau permettono di osservare come questo accrescimento in Puglia sia minore nella parte di ramo esposta a Sud. A Firenze, invece, tale accrescimento non subisce sensibili variazioni in funzione della esposizione. Il t confronto fra le caratteristiche climatiche dei due diversi ambienti esaminati porta ad attribuire tale minore accrescimento all'azione sopraottimale della luce. Ci  confermato in pratica dal fatto che i peri innestati su cotogno ed allevati nani, se ombreggiati opportunamente, assumono una vegetazione pi rigogliosa. Il lavoro ha portato ad una netta conferma di quanto affermato dai pratici e cio che in Puglia si ha una vegetazione pi rigogliosa nella parte esposta a Nord della chioma. Measurements of transversal wood growth in pear-trees of the Butirra Clairgeau variety have shown that in Puglia there is less growth on the side of the branch facing South. In the Florence area instead wood growth does not appear to be dependent on the situation of the branch in respect of the Cardinal points. The comparison of the climatic characteristics of the two different habitats makes it possible to attribute the difference in growth habit to the light factor. This is confirmed by the observation that pear-trees grafted on quince r trees and brought up in a dwarfish habit, when conveniently shadowed by vine-trees, bear a more luxuriant vegetation. The results of these researches agree entirely with what is commonly stated by pratcical fruit-growers, namely that in Puglia pear-tree foliage is more luxuriant on the North facing side of the plant.
42872131|The observations on the rooting habitus of young myrobalan seedlings and twelve year-old plum trees, performed in the Experiment Orchard of the Istituto di Coltivazioni Arboree of Florence University, have shown that: 1) in trasplanting the myrobalan plum seedlings, the principal root is unavoidably cut and ceases of getting longer. Secondary roots replace it and form with the plant axis a very opened angle; 2) the root system of twelve year-old plum trees, grown in the soil conditions of the plain of Florence (see the prospect N. 1) has its normal development between 6 and 24 inches of depth. A few roots reach the underlying levels of the soil, going also 6,6 feet deep from the field surface. The lateral extension of the root system overcomes the projection of the branches on the soil. The absorbent root hairs are previously localized in the upper level of the soil and in the peripheric zone of the root system.
42872153|Nel centro frutticolo della regione emiliano-romagnola sono lamentati da tempo fenomeni di deperimento tanto nelle pomacee che nelle drupacee. Le cause di questo fenomeno sono di diversa origine, non tutte ancora chiarite. Nel presente scritto sono illustrate le caratteristiche e l'importanza delle alterazioni dell'apparato radicale, osservate durante il 1950. In particolare vengono descritti il colpo di freddo, i tumori batterici, il marciume da Armillaria e da Phytophthora. Chiudono alcune osservazioni sull'opportunit di migliorare la produzione vivaistica da un punto di vista fitopatologia). In the fruit centres of Emilia and Romagna phenomena of deperishment both in pomacee and in drupacee have been observed since some time. The cause of these phenomena are numerous and of various origin, and they have not yet been fully understood. In the present article the characteristics and the importance of the root system alterations observed in 1950 are dexcribed. In particular a description is given of cold strikes, bacterial tumours of Armillaria and Phytophtora rot. The Author finally points out the opportunity of improving nurseries from the point of view of disease control.
42872156|In this paper the results obtained from self- and cross-pollinations of Sweet cherries are described. Generational sterility seems to occur in the Marasca di Piemonte variety, whose pollen fails almost entirely to germinate; the pollen of all the other tested varieties proved to be perfectly normal and viable. Experiments, performed at Florence since 1949, show that all the fifteen varieties are self-incompatible; cross-incompatibility is common. The co-incompatible varieties and the effective and non-effective cross-pollinations are sintetically shown in Table 1, to make possible the choice of the best associations of compatible varieties.

42872201|Vegetable marrows growing in hotbeds near Florence were observed to show a sickly condition. The plants remained stunted; many secundary roots had rotted and the tap-root showed brown discolorations due to the presence of Thielaviopsis basicola. Because of the constant presence of antagonistic bacteria the A. was not able to isolate the fungus. Experimental inoculations with a strain of Th. bastela that the A. previously isolated from endive showed this strain to be moderately pathogenic also vegetable marrow. Soil sterilisation is recommanded.

There is described a rot of peach fruits, still attached to the trees, which has been found in the Ferrara's and Ravenna's country. The rotting, which has a leather dark colour, is localized in corrispondance of the middle track in the fruit's equatorial zone. The infection does not seem to be related to a preexistyng injury of the epidermis cells. The cause of the disease is this infection of the fungus Rhizopus nigricans; of such a fungus by means of artificial inoculation, it has been tested the growing rate according the fruit's different range of development. 42873061|Nel presente lavoro gli A.A. intendono portare un primo contributo allo studio della applicazione del trattamento al calice dei if rutti nella lotta contro la Carpocapsa pomonella L La sperimentazione viene da essi suddivisa in due parti: nella prima trattano la messa a punto del momento botanico pi adatto per l'intervento insetticida preventivo eu tredici diverse variet di Melo; nella seconda riferiscono modalit e dati di una applicazione sperimentale dell'irrorazione al calice sulle tre variet di pi larga coltivazione nell'ambiente in cui hanno operato. Essi confermano l'importanza della ubicazione dei locali adibiti alla lavorazione e conservazione della frutta e materiali relativi in rapporto alla gravit dell'infestazione dell'insetto. Authors' wish, is to give a preliminary study of calys spray treatment in the problem of controlling the Codling-moth (Carpocapsa pomonella L.). Experimental investigations are described in 2 parts. In the first part, the best time during the blossom development of applying preventive lead arsenate sprays on 13 different varieties of apple trees is studied; in the 2d part data and modalities of an experimental application of calix spraying on 3 varieties, largely cultivated on field under Padana Valley (Italy) conditions, are noticed. It was found that tested varieties had a different reception of Codling-moth through calyx cup entries, consequently it is thought to be available, treatment application only on the most receptive ones. Furthermore it is thought that calix spray is especially usefull and economically advantageous against Carpocapsa (Cydia) pomonella L. when no more than three cover sprays perform it. In this paper the importance, where working-rooms store-rooms equipment and accessories for fruits are placed in respect to the severity of the infestation on apple tree is confirmed.

42872215|The Author examines the reasons which have hindered the production of canned olives in Italy. The climatic and pedologic conditions of countries such as Spain, Greece, California and Algeria in which there is a high production of canned olives is compared with those of the main Italian centres (Ascoli Piceno, Puglie, Sicily). It appears that the low production of canned olives in Italy is due to the poor tecnique of our growers, especially as concerns planting and cultural practices. In order to increase the production of canned olives in Italy it is necessary to treat the tree quite like the other fruit trees : olive orchards should therefore be planted in fertile soils, either irrigated or sufficiently moist in summer time, and all the cultural practices capable of producing high yields and fruits of good quality should be put into practice.
42872217|L'Autore riferisce i risultati di alcune ricerche sulla biologia fiorale e di fecondazione del finocchio dolce, condotte allo scopo di poter impostare il relativo lavoro di selezione e produzione in purezza delle sementi. Le razze di finocchio dolce, attualmente coltivate, sono risultate autocompatibili. Le diverse razze si sono; mostrate intercompatibili ed inoltre esse hanno mostrato di poter essere fecondate anche con polline di altre variet botaniche della medesima specie, Foeni culum vulgre (Mill.). Tali risultati hanno portato l'Autore a concludere che l'attuale degenerazione delle razze di finocchio pu essere attribuita essenzialmente alla presenza, presso le colture desti, nate a seme, di piante comunque estranee alla razza da selezionare o da riprodurre. Per la produzione in purezza delle sementi di finocchio occorre, pertanto, che gli agricoltori isolino rigorosamente, durante la fioritura, le piante appartenenti allo standard della razza. After having examinated the considerable losses that annually affect the fennel culture owing to deficient purity of seeds, the A. refers on the results of some researches carried on the flower biological behaviour and pollination of these plants in view to begin the selection and production of  genuine  seeds. The fennel cultivated varieties have resulted self-fertile. All varieties have proved to be interfertile and besides they have shown may be pollinated even from the pollen of different botanical varieties of Foeniculum vulgre (Mill.). These results induce the A. to conclude that reasons of the present degeneration of cultivated fennel varieties may be ascribed to the presence, in the cultures for seeds production, of plants belonging from different strains or other botanical variety. To obtain fennel genuine seeds, therefore, it is necessary the farmers rigorously keep away the plants of the same strain.

The results obtained have showed that all the cucumber cultivated varieties tested have proved self- and inter-fertile and the pollination is accomplished largely by bees. The cross-pollination is the rule between adjacent varieties; that it's a very common cause of varietal mixture and of varieties's degeneration. Therefore, in the production of genuine seed, it's necessary to make a rigorous selection in monovarietal cultures.

The Autor refers his observations performed at the Horticultural Experiment Farm of the National Research Council annexed to the Horticultural Institution of the Florence's University, on the genetic behavour of peach hybrid populations. The observations have shown that:  showy flowers are dominant over non-showy and the characters are controlled by one pair of genes;  in the inheritance of stone adhesion the semi-cling can be classified either the frees or the clings, since they usually vary from semi-cling to free or from semicling to cling. The data show that free is dominant over cling and follow the simple mendelian rules;  it's confirmed the correlation between the type of gland and the indentations on the margin of the leaf. The margin of the leaves bearing globose glands are serratecrenate, that of leaves bearing reniform glands are crenate and the glandless leaves are distincly serrate. The characters follow the incomplete dominance suggesting that might be controlled by the same pair of genes, or by a linkage;  it might be a probable correlation between peach leaf color and peach flesh color. Leaves from yellow-fleshed varieties and hybrids have a yellow color more deep than white-fleshed ones.

Si prospettano le cause che possono aver provocato il fenomeno: variazione della velocit nel gradiente di concentrazione dei glucidi, labilit ormonale, alterazione della reazione chimica e della pressione osmotica. Si constata la presenza di notevole quantit di inulina sia nello scapo fiorale, sia nel peduncolo del cormo avventizio, reperto nuovo nelle Iridacee, ma non riscontrato nei Gladioli normali. In questi si trova invece un altro idrato di carbonio che presenta alcuni caratteri dell'lrisina. I cormi avventizi non hanno riprodotto il fenomeno, n  stato possibile provocarlo artificialmente. La loro coltivazione ha dato luogo a fioriture scadenti. During the 1950 crop season of corms of hybrid Gladiolus, an unusual production of adventitious corms on the stems, was observed. The corms were normal in shape, structure and polarity. Reference is made to physical and chemical causes of the anomaly. Information is given on the presence of inulin in the stems and peduncles of adventitious corms. This result is remarkable inasmuch as inulina is not present in normal Gladiolus, which contain another carbohydrate, probably irisin. Adventitious corms have not reproduced the anomaly, and did not form fine flowers. No reaction has been observed in normal Gladiolus stems kept in wet air or plunged in water.

42873713|The results obtained with the phosphorganic, systemic insecticides of the OMPA (Pestox III and Pestox 66) and Systox types are preliminarly reported. The phytodynamic activity has been tested in laboratory with several methods. With the Lemna test the number of individuals increased, but the average number of fronds for each individual decreased. On terrestrial plants the average dry weight increased, much more with Systox than with Pestox. The insecticidal effect was favorable against 15 members of the Hemiptera order, of which 10 Aphids, and against 2 Red Mites on fruit trees. The best concentration (for spraying) appears to be 0,1-0,2%, for treatment shortly after the petals fall, with 2 (Pome-fruit trees) or 3 (Stone-fruit trees) consecutive treatments. The average lenght of the insecticidal effect in spring is, for Pestox 66, 2-3 (Aphids) or 3-4 (Red Mites) weeks, and for Systox 1-1,5 (Aphids) or 2 (Red Mites) weeks. Long after the end of the evident insecticidal effect, a depression in the subsequent maximal growth of Red Mites population (as related to untreated test) is described; this unusual after-effect is tentatively interpretated ond the base of some slightly toxic residual or by the increase of the total leaf surface for each tree or by both reasons.

The Kaiser trees budded or grafted on this stock, give a very poor growth, produce small branches and little leaves and sometimes die even in the first year. Microscopical observations showed that the bud and the graft union occurs normally. No anatomical discontinuity between scion and stock has been detected. A normal flow of a colored solution has been observed through the point of union. The A. concludes that the incompatibility of Kaiser pear on quince stock cannot be ascribed to anatomical abnormalities but probably it depends from other physiological factors. In view to mantein the quince rootstock a double-work of Kaiser on B. Hardy or Curato is suggested.

42873206|Following the various experiments carried out during a number of years with the root systems of peach trees in the neighbourhood of Florence, described by the author in 1941, the research was extended to orchards of the Ferrara and Forli districts. In this way not only were some important results confirmed, but others were obtained with the spread and penetrationt in depth of root systems under clean cultivation, in cropping and sod. The cultivation of lucerne under the trees was found to have definite ill effects, causing poor aeration of the soil and competition, specially for water, which forces the roots of the peach trees to develop superficially, and therefore to suffer damage and amputation during winter ploughing. The importance of tillage and manuring of the soil was very clearly shown, in negative contrast with sod soil and the competition of self sown grass. Even in non-transplanted trees the tap roots disappear, being substituted by large roots developing obliquely down into the soil. Generally the majority of the roots are found in depths of from 25 to 100 cms. where conditions are most suited to them. Particulars concerning apple, pear, peach and cherry trees were published by the author in the  Report of the Thirteenth International Horticultural Congress, 1952.

42872666|L'A. mette in evidenza come la  disaffinit , termine con il quale si suole genericamente esprimere l'incapacit di alcune piante innestate a funzionare come individui unici, possa essere determinata da cause talvolta diverse. Egli chiarisce come nelle piante arboree da frutto possano distinguersi tipi differenti di disaffinit e si sofferma ad illustrarne tre di fondamentale importanza: 1) quella superabile con il sovrinnesto, ossia mediante l'interposizione fra nesto e soggetto di un terzo bionte (intermediario) reciprocamente affine; 2) quella non superabile anche mediante il sovrinnesto; 3) quella indotta proprio dalla aggiunta di un terzo bionte, anche se reciprocamente affine con ciascuno degli altri due. The A. points out as the  incompatibility , term generally adopted to denote the inability of grafted plants to function as a unit, may depend upon a variety of causes. He makes clear as in the fruit trees one may distinguish several types of incompatibility and he describes three of these of great pratical importance in the doubleworking tecnique: 1) incompatibility that is possible to overcome by the doubleworking tecnique, inserting between scion and rootstock an intermediate variety receprocally compatible; 2) incompatibility that is not possible to overcome by the doubleworking tecnique; 3) incompatibility induced just by the addition of another scion.

Those considerations inspired Prof. Fruhstorfer to produce his  Universal Soil . The author mentions that the basic specifications  due to the performance of the components and the particular manufacturing process  can be summarised as follows: structure; aseptioness; rational allotment of nutritional salts. He then illustrates the efficiency of the universal soil in growing potted plants. Finally he closes emphasizing the universal soil's advantages and expressing the hope that its use may rapidly spread also in Italy, in the interest of horticultural technique and economy. Bezugnehmend auf die wechselseitigen Bebiehungen zwischen den Pflanzen und der normalen Kulturerde, will der Autor dieser Zellen einige seiner Betrachtungen mitteilen, die den Begriff eines einzigen Substrates fuer alle Pflanzen rechtfertigt, Betrachtungen, die Herrn Prof. Fruhstorfer zur Erfindung und zur Vewirklichung der Einheitserde gefuehrt haben. Grundlegende Requisten, die den Eigenshaften der Bestandteile zu verdanken sind, sowie ihrer speziellen Verarbeitung. Sie ergeben sich aus der Struktur, das Material ist voellig aseptisch, und siezeigen sich in der hoechst razionellen Dosierung der Naehrsalze. Schliesslich beshreibt er die Auswirkungen hinsichtlich der Kultur von Topfpflanzen. Abschliessend hebt er alle Vorteile hervor, die sich aus der Anwendung der Einheitserde ergeben und gibt seiner Hoffnung Ausdruck, dass diese Einheitserde sich auch schnellstens in Italien durchsetzen moege im Interesse und zum Nutzen der Ekonomie und Technik im Cartenbau.

42872711|Gli AA. sperimentano l'influenza dell'acido -naftalenacetico (puro ed in forma commerciale) contro la caduta prematura delle pere  Buona Cristiana Williams . Indagano inoltre intorno l'influenza che la sostanza di crescita, irrorata come anticascola, pu esplicare nella maturazione dei frutti alla raccolta, dopo conservazione in frigorifero e dopo maturazione in camera calda (18  20C) e in camera semifredda (10-12). Nelle condizioni di ambiente e di esperimento degli AA. molto evidente risulta l'efficacia dell'acido -naftalenacetico (puro ed in forma commerciale) contro la cascola prematura delle  Williams . La sostanza fa sentire la sua azione anticascola dopo circa tre giorni dall'irrorazione; la sua azione persiste evidentissima fino a circa 10-11 giorni dall'irrorazione, poi diminuisce sensibilmente, ma non completamente. Nelle piante trattate la percentuale finale di cascola alla raccolta varia, a seconda degli individui, da 4,5% a 11,1%; nelle piante di controllo tale percentuale varia da 19,8% a 33,9%. Le indagini intorno l'influenza della sostanza di crescita sulla maturazione dei frutti, mostrano la manifestazione a distanza del fenomeno. Lo stato di maturazione dei frutti non sembra subire variazioni alla raccolta (sopratutto quando questa non  troppo ritardata) per opera della sostanza di crescita, mentre un'accelerazione di maturazione risulta costante ed abbastanza evidente nei frutti trattati alla fine del periodo di conservazione in frigorifero. L'accelerazione di maturazione per opera del trattamento risulta tanto pi evidente quanto pi tardiva  la raccolta. Il maggiore intenerimento della polpa e lo sviluppo del disfacimento risultano gli indici pi sensibili per indicare l'avanzato stato di maturazione dei frutti trattati. Il trattamento non porta conseguenze sulle qualit organolettiche dei frutti dopo maturazione in camera calda (1820C), mentre migliora leggermente le qualit organolettiche dei frutti maturati in camera semifredda (1012C). Il periodo richiesto per la maturazione dei frutti risulta solo leggermente influenzato dal trattamento ormonico. The AA. have been carrying out erperiments with a view to determining how far -naphthaleneacetic acid (chemically pure and commercial) can prevent the pre-harvest drop of  Bartlett  pears. The have also been doing research work on the effect that the spraying of growth-substance may exercise on the ripening of pears at harvest-time, after they have been kept in the storage, and after they have ripened in a  warm room  6568F), and in a  cool room  (5054F). Under AA. experimental conditions, naphthaleneacetic acid (chemically pure and commercial) has proved most effective in preventing the pre-harvest drop of  Bartlett  pears. Its anti-drop action makes itself felt some 3 day after spraying, and lasts quite noticeably until the 10th. or 11th. day after spraying; after which it diminishes considerably, but never quite ceases. In the trees treated, the final harvest-time drop percentage varies from 4,5% to 11,1%, according to individuals; while in the trees not treated it varies from 19,8% to 33,9%. The research work carried out on the effects of growth-substance on the ripening of pears has made it clear that it has a delayed action. At harvest time (particularly if this is not too late) there is no apparent difference in the degree of ripeness of pears treated with the growthsubstance and pears not treated, but there is a regular and quite marked speeding up in the ripening of treated pears after they havebeen kept for 50 55 days in the storage. The later the pears are gathered, the more quickly do they ripen as a consequence of the treatment. The most reliable signs of the advanced stage of ripeness of pears so treated are the softening and the internal break-down. The dessert quality of pears ripened in a  warm room  (6568 F) was unaffected by the treatment; while in the case of those ripened in a  cool room  (5054 F), the dessert quality appeared to be slightly enhanced. The time of ripening is only slightly affected by the hormonic treatment.

The autor reports the results of a proof carried out for the propagating of cauliflower, cultivar  Primaticcio di Toscana  and Savoy cabbage, cultivar  Comune da estate  by leaf cuttings. The cuttings were treated during 24 hours in a solution containing 20 parts per milion of -nafthylacetic acide, before being placed in the sand bench. The rooting of cuttings thus treated was almost complete; less complete was, instead, the test rooting. Two months later the leaf cuttings of the Savoy cabbage gave to new plants out of the axillary bud; from the leaf cuttings of the cauliflower were gotten sprouts from adventitious buds, wich died soon after. The author concludes considering the improving of such method to be very useful thanks to the remarkable advantages wich it can afford in the propagating of plants intended for seeds production.

42873317|Dai risultati di una esperienza di concimazione alle cipolle e dalla loro discussione risulta che solo la concimazione azotata, e non quella solfatica, ha determinato un notevole aumento di produzione. Il sapore acre delle cipolle, gi forte nei testimoni non concimati, viene sensibilmente attenuato sia ad opera dei cloruri, che, un po' meno, dei sali ammoniacali ; particolarmente efficace si  mostrato il cloruro ammonico. Si presenta una probabile interpretazione fisiologica dei risultati, la quale lascerebbe intravedere una pi efficace azione dolcificante dei nitrati ; si discute il valore pratico dei risultati. Results from a fertilization trial on onions are presented. Ammonia nitrogen increased the yield, while no effect was shown by sulfur (as sulfate). The onion pungency, which was strong on the control, has been reduced appreciably by chlorides and, to a less extent, by ammonia ; the sweetest bulbes were obtained from plots fertilized with ammonia chloride. A temptative explanation of the results is given on physiological basis, and a stronger effect of nitrate-ion is suggested. Practical applications are discussed.

42872836|L'A. riferisce sui risultati di alcune esperienze sulla vernalizzazione a freddo dei piselli da orto (Pisum Sativum L.), condotte durante gli anni 1955 e 1956.  stato rilevato che nelle cinque cultivar sperimentate il trattamento vernalizzante applicato ai semi non ha determinato sensibili effetti sull'accrescimento delle piante, n alcun anticipo delle loro fasi di sviluppo. The Author refers about the results of some investigations performed during 1955 and 1956 on the cold vernalization of garden peas (Pisum Sativum L.). The yields of vegetables, fresh substance and shelled peas are not considerably increased by the vernalization. Those results suggest that the low temperature treatments can not modify the vegetative behaviour of the garden peas.

42872858|L'Autore riporta alcune segnalazioni di casi in cui la disaftinit d'innesto sarebbe stata praticamente superata lasciando sviluppare un apparato foliare anche dal soggetto oltre che dal nesto. Dette segnalazioni riguardano diversi casi di disaffinit, tanto su piante arboree quanto su piante erbacee, ed alcune di esse sono state ometto di accurati controlli sperimentali. Sulla base di tali elementi, l'A. ha condotto alcune indagini allo scopo di approfondire l'argomento ed accertare sperimentalmente la reale efficacia del suddetto metodo nel caso della ben nota disaffinit d'innesto del pero  Kaiser  su cotogno. Allevando in vivaio alcune piante di  Kaiser /cotogno normalmente prive di foglie del soggetto, accanto ad altre cui erano stati invece lasciati sviluppare appositamente uno, oppure due rami anche dal cotogno, l'A. ha potuto accertare che la forte riduzione di sviluppo del nesto  ossia la pi evidente manifestazione della disaffinit nelle piante  Kaiser /cotogno  appare ugualmente grave in tutti i casi, anche quando il soggetto si dimostra capace di emettere germogli vigorosi. Oltre a concludere, quindi, sulla pratica inefficacia del suddetto metodo nei riguardi degli innesti di  Kaiser /cotogno, l'A. discute le possibili cause determinanti la disaffinit e mette in evidenza come, in questo caso, non possa ritenersi valida n l'ipotesi basata su una presunta incapacit delle foglie del nesto a produrre particolari sostanze necessarie per la normale vegetazione del soggetto, n l'altra ipotesi secondo cui la disaffinit potrebbe essere causata dall'azione negativa di alcune sostanze che verrebbero prodotte dalle foglie del nesto e che sarebbero tossiche o comunque nocive al soggetto. Nel caso della disaffinit d'innesto della  Kaiser /cotogno, collegando le varie acquisizioni finora raggiunte sull'argomento, la disaffinit stessa appare di natura pi complessa, probabilmente determinata da particolari reazioni biochimiche tra i due bionti. L'A. ha potuto accertare, infine, che mentre nelle piante aventi solo apparato foliare del nesto si pu riscontrare un'anormale carenza di amido nel soggetto, in tutti quei casi in cui il cotogno  invece fornito di foglie proprie il contenuto in amido risulta pressoch analogo nei tessuti di entrambi i bionti. Pertanto, l'accumulo di amido nel nesto e la relativa carenza nel soggetto non pu essere considerata n come una-causa immediata della disaffinit, n come sintomo necessariamente legato alla disaffinit stessa. The Author summarizes the knowledges of some cases in which the graft uncongeniality would have been practically overcomed allowing to a leaves system from both the scion and the rootstock. On the basis of such knowledges the Author carried out some researches in view to dive deep into the subject and to experimentally ascertain in the actual efficiency of the above mentioned method in the case of the incompatibility of the  Kaiser  pear on quince. Raising in a nursery some  Kaiser /quince plants without leaves from the rootstock, and other ones provided of one-two shoots even from the quince, the Author has been able to ascertain that the strong growth reduction of the scion (wich represents the most evident symptom of the uncongeniality in the young  Kaiser /quince trees) results serious in all the cases, and even when rootstock proves to be able to grow vigorously. Therefore, besides to have concluded the practical ineffectiveness of such a method in the case of the  Kaiser /quince union, the Author discusses the possible causes of that uncongeniality and points out as how in this case it cannot be assumed neither the hypothesis based on a presumed inability of the scion leaves to provide some specific substances necessary for the rootstock normal growth, nor the other according to wich the incompatibility could be caused by a negative action of some specific substances, produced by the scion leaves, and poisonous for the rootstock. In connection with the other knowledges till now acquired on this subject, the cause of the uncongeniality between  Kaiser  and quince seems to be of more complex nature, probably induced by biochemical reactions between rootstock and scion. The Author has ascertained that, while for the trees provided with a leaf system of the scion only there is a lack of starch in the rootstock in all the other cases in wich even the quince is provided of its own leaves the starch content results about equal in rootstock and scion tissues. Therefore, the starch accumulation in the scion and its relative lack in the rootstock cannot be assumed neither as a cause nor as a symptom necessarily joined with the uncongeniality.
42872860|The Author refers about some research carried out during 1955 and 1956 on the flower biological behaviour and pollination requirement of the carrot in view to improve the methods of the commercial seed production. The results have shown the tested carrot cultivars as self- and inter-compatible and cross-compatible with some other botanical varieties of Daucus Carota L. (wild carrots). The pollination of the carrots is largely carried out by bees. These results suggest that cross-pollination is the main reason of the carrot cultivars degeneration. Therefore, to obtain genuine seeds, it is necessary to breed the mother-plants of each cultivar in different far off fields and to keep away all the plants belonging to different strains or other botanical variety.

42883597|In base ad alcune sistematiche ricerche sull'epoca pi opportuna per eseguire la potatura invernale di produzione del pesco, l'. ha potuto determinare e confrontare gli effetti esercitati dalle minime termiche del febbraio e del marzo 1956 su peschi potati prima e dopo le minime termiche stesse. Le osservazioni, condotte su diverse cultivar ed in tre diversi ambienti dell'Italia centrale, hanno messo in evidenza che, a parit di qualsiasi altra condizione, i danni provocati dal gelo sui peschi gi potati sono risultati sostanzialmente uguali a quelli dei peschi potati pi tardi. Anche se, in un primo tempo, si  talvolta effettivamente rilevato un danno leggermente pi grave sui primi, qualche mese dopo, ad allegagione avvenuta, si  constatato che ogni differenza tra gli alberi potati avanti o dopo il gelo tende a scomparire, probabilmente per effetto di una pi elevata percentuale di allegagione in quegli alberi che erano stati pi danneggiati. L'A. conclude, quindi, precisando che l'opportunit di rimandare la potatura al pi tardi possibile in primavera non dipenderebbe tanto dal fatto che gli alberi potati sono pi sensibili alle minime termiche invernali, quanto dal vantaggio pratico che si ha, ritardando la potatura stessa, di regolarla in base ad ogni eventuale danno provocato dal gelo, o da altre cause avverse. L'A. riporta, infine, alcune osservazioni in merito alla variabile entit dei danni da freddo, cos come questi possono essere riscontrati su diversi alberi, in base ad un solo rilevamento od a pi rilevamenti successivi, anche su di una medesima cultivar e nell'ambito di uno stesso appezzamento. The author refers about some researches carried out in view to ascertain and to compare the injuries amount caused by the frost of February and March 1956 on peach trees pruned at different times, before and after each frost occurrence. Such observations, performed on different varieties and in three different countries of the central Italy, have shown that, any other conditions being equal, the winter frost injuries on peach trees already pruned were substantially the same of those found on later pruned trees. Even though a slightly more serious damage was observed in the former, some time later, that is after fruit set, any difference disappeared, probably because of an high fruit set percentage on the trees with more seriously reduced number of flower buds. The author concludes pointing out that the convenience to delay as late as possible the pruning time may not depend up to the fact that the pruned trees are more sensible to the low winter temperatures, but may be due all the same to the practical possibility of an easier regulation of the pruning severity after any eventual winter frost injury or other damage occourrence. At last, the author refers about some osservations on the variable amount of frost injuries, as they can result on different trees, on the basis of one or more repeated remarks, even with the same variety and in a same orchard.
42883598|A rot and drying of the Euphorbia hermentiana Lem. destroying about 50 percent of a commercial culture, has been described in comparison with the same disease of E. resinifera Berg. By wound inoculation the disease has been reproduced only on members of the Euphorbiaceae family (10 species at all) but not on members of 6 families of succulent plants (29 species at all). After the study of the morphology of the causative agent, either in nature and in colture, it has been concluded that it is caused by the form gattefossei of the Coniothyrium concentricum (= C. gattefossei). It appears as a biological form specialised on members of the Euphorbiaceae species, while the type species is found also on other families of the flowering plants, chiefly Monocotyledons.

42873359|Field and laboratory investigations undertaken to study the behavior of compound S-[(methylcarbamyl) methyl] 0, 0, dimethyl dithiophosphate used against the Cherry Fruit Fly (Rhagoletis cerasi L.), have shown that this insecticide does not kill the eggs that have been laid into the cherries after the compound has been sprayed but the larvae die just after hatching and before they start to damage the fruit. Further field experiments have indicated that a single high-or also low-volume application of this insecticide achieves an excellent control (99,3%-99,7%) of the Cherry Fruit Fly even when every fruit of the unsprayed trees contains more than one maggot. Detailed information on insecticide residue at time of harvest will be presented in a coming paper.

42873361|Viene descritta una virosi del Pittosporum tobira caratterizzata dalla decolorazione delle nervature fogliari, sopratutto quelle di secondo e terzo ordine, raramente con decolorazione ad anello, e con ripiegatura a doccia delle foglie, che appaiono aggregate a rosetta all'apice dei rametti. La malattia  stata riprodotta per innesto di corteccia con apparizione della decolorazione delle nervature di secondo e terzo ordine. Non si hanno ancora elementi circa una trasmissione della virosi anche per seme. Tale malattia appare diversa dalle due virosi segnalate in California sullo stesso genere di piante. A virus disease of Pittosporum tobira is described. It is characterized by vein-clearing, chiefly of the second and third order nerves, rarely with ring-spot, and with leaf curling. The leaves are rosetted. The disease has been transmitted by bark grafting: after about seven months the leaves showed a vein-clearing. It has not been yet established if the disease is also seed-transmissible. It appears to be different from Pittosporum virus diseases described in California.

42873740|Partendo da alcune recenti acquisizioni, secondo le quali il primo e principale sintomo della disaffinit fra pero e cotogno  rappresentato dalla discontinuit fra i tessuti corticali dei due bionti ed in frase alla constatazione che tale discontinuit esercita effetti analoghi a quelli di una vera e propria incisione anulare al punto d'innesto, l'Autore ha preso in esame l'eventuale possibilit che la riduzione del vigore ottenuta innestando il pero su cotogno debba essere anch'essa interpretata come conseguenza diretta della disaffinit. Alcune indagini condotte a questo riguardo su 232 alberi di pero/cotogno di cinque anni dall'innesto, appartenenti a 50 cultivar diverse di pero, hanno permesso di accertare che non vi  alcuna correlazione fra il vigore ed il grado di disaffinit degli alberi stessi. Pertanto, si conclude che lo sviluppo e la vigoria di ciascun albero sono manifestazioni attribuibili a cause fisiologiche non necessariamente legate a quelle che provocano la disaffinit. Starting from some recent knowledges on the incompatibility disorders that may be found in the bark of practically all the pear/quince trees, the author discusses the possibility that even the dwarfing effect of the quince rootstock could be considered as a direct consequence of the incompatibility with the pear varieties. Some observation on 232 five years old pear trees, belonging to 50 different varieties, grafted on the same clonal quince stock and grown under the same conditions, have pointed out that no correlation exists between vigor and incompatibility degree of the trees.
42873741|Sono state eseguite ricerche circa l'influenza della prematurazione a 22+24C. sulla successiva conservazione in regime di freddo delle pesche cv.  J. H. Hale . Gli AA. hanno studiato l'influenza di tale trattamento sulle caratteristiche organolettiche, sulla durata di conservazione e sullo sviluppo delle muffe che pi frequentemente aggrediscono il frutto dopo la raccolta. L'influenza della prematurazione sullo sviluppo delle qualit organolettiche  stata studiata seguendo in frigorifero a+1-2C. il metabolismo degli zuccheri riducenti, del saccarosio, dell'acidit totale, della quantit di succo, della durezza della polpa e mediante prove di degustazione. La durata di conservazione fu stabilita in funzione della diminuzione delle qualit organolettiche ed in funzione di alterazioni caratteristiche della polpa provocanti o la pastosit e l'asciuttezza dei tessuti o l'imbrunimento dei tessuti pi vicino al nocciolo. Dalla sperimentazione emerge con evidenza l'influenza positiva della prematurazione sullo sviluppo delle qualit organolettiche delle pesche  J. H. Hale : in ogni caso i frutti risultarono pi succosi, pi zuccherini, meno acidi, pi profumati e saporiti di quelli non prematurati e cio posti in frigorifero subito dopo la raccolta. La prematurazione non abbrevi la durata di conservazione quando fu limitata a un massimo di due giorni. Prematurazioni pi prolungate raccorciarono proporzionalmente la possibile vita dei frutti. La prematurazione aument lo sviluppo delle muffe (Sclerotinia fructicola e Rizopus): tale influenza negativa risult tanto maggiore quanto maggiore fu la durata del periodo di prematurazione. Research has been carried about the influence of delayed storage at a temperature of 22-4C on the subsequent storage of  J. H. Hale  peaches. The AA. have studied the influence of such treatment on the dessert quality, on the storage life and on the development of rot infections that more frequently attack the fruit after harvest. The influence of delayed storage on the development of the dessert quality has been studied following in cold storage (+1-2C), the metabolism of the reducing sugars, saccharose, total acidity, quantity of juice, firmness of the flesh and by essays of tasting. The storage life was established be it according to the reduction of dessert quality, be it according to the development of physiological disorders of the flesh causing either  woolliness  and juiceless, or browning of the tissues nearer to the stone. From the experimental work it is evident the positive influence of the delayed storage on the development of dessert quality of  J. H. Hale peaches : in any case fruits became more juicy, sweeter, less acid an with more flavour and taste than those which were not pre-ripened, that is placed in cold storage at once after the harvest. Pre-ripening did not shorten the keeping storage life when it was limited to a maximum of two days. Longer pre-ripening shortened proportionately the possible storage life of fruits. Delayed storage increased the development of rot infections (Sclerotinia fructicola and Rizophus): such a negative influence resulted as great as was the lasting of the pre-ripening.
42873743|La malattia del pesco trovata in Versilia  molto simile al  Peach canker  da Fusicoecum amygdali Del. assai diffuso attualmente negli Stati Uniti. Una differenza fondamentale esiste per nei riguardi del micete patogeno in quanto quello osservato da me non pu essere identificato come Fusicoecum sp. bens come Phomopsis sp. Ad ogni modo sar utile uno scambio di notizie e di campioni fra i due paesi per un migliore chiarimento del caso. Da noi la malattia in questione, per quanto sia per ora assal localizzata,  assai violenta. La morte dei rametti si manifesta per la maggior parte dopo l'inverno, dal rigonfiamento delle gemme fino all'estate. In tale periodo avviene la formazione dei picnidi. Nella tarda primavera e nell'estate, se questa decorre umida, si manifestano nuove infezioni sui rametti dell'anno, sia in corrispondenza di gemme, sia alla base dei rametti stessi, sia in corrispondenza di ferite. Tali infezioni si sviluppano pi estesamente nella successiva stagione autunnale. Numerose infezioni sui rametti pi vigorosi vengono circoscritte dalla reazione della pianta. Il parassita per si mantiene vivo sia nella corteccia che nel legno gi colpiti da dove pu riprendere la sua azione patogena quando la pianta si sveglia dal riposo invernale. The disease of peach-tree found in Versilia is very similar to the  Peach-canker  from Fusicoccum amygdali Del. which is actually widespread in the United States. The pathogen observed cannot be identified with Fusicoccum sp. but with Phomopsis sp. At any rate an exchange of information and of samples between the two countries will be useful for a better understanding of this case. In our country the above mentioned disease is till now strictly localize but is also very violent. The death of small branches appears generally after the winter from the swelling of the buds till summer. In this period the  picnidia  are formed. In late spring and in summer, if this is damp, other infections appear on the small branches of the year, in connection with buds or at the base of the branches, or whereever there is a wound. These infections develop themselves mostly in the following fall. Many infections on the most vigorous branches are encircled by the reaction of the plant. But the pathogen ist still alive in the bark of the plant and in the wood, already infected, where it may start again its action when the plant arises from its winter rest.

42873548|La vigoria iniziale dei germogli di pesco in primavera risulta tanto pi ridotta quanto pi tardi si  eseguita la potatura invernale, nonostante che l'epoca di schiusura delle gemme rimanga sempre la stessa. Allo scopo di apportare un contributo allo studio delle cause che determinano siffatto comportamento, sono state condotte alcune indagini per due anni consecutivi. Queste hanno permesso, fra l'altro, di accertare che: 1) lo sviluppo iniziale dei germogli  praticamente uguale anche se, invece di potare, si tolgono tutte le gemme sul tratto di ramo che avrebbe dovuto essere asportato, oppure se si esegue una decorticazione anulare in corrispondenza del punto in cui avrebbe dovuto essere applicato il taglio di potatura; 2) su questi ultimi rami decorticati, lo sviluppo iniziale dei primi germogli apicali  praticamente uguale a quello dei corrispondenti germogli apicali sui rami di controllo, ai quali non era stata applicata nessuna operazione di potatura. In base soprattutto a queste due osservazioni principali, si  indotti a ritenere che la vigoria iniziale dei germogli non sia determinata soltanto da cause nutrizionali, secondo i concetti pi comunemente diffusi, ma possa essere regolata anche da altri fattori ed in particolare da un meccanismo di inibizione che sarebbe fissato nelle gemme gi prima della loro chiusura, in rapporto alla posizione da queste occupata sul ramo. In spring time the initial vigour of peach shoots results the more reduced then the winther pruning is applied later nevertheless the buds opening time remains unchanged. In view to contribute for a best understanding of the causes of such a behaviour, some researches have been carried out for two consecutive years. Those allowed to ascertain that: 1) The initial growth of the shoots is pratically the same even if instead of pruning one takes away all the buds from the branch portion that should be cutted off, or if one takes away a ring of bark in the point were should be applied the pruning cut; 2) on the ringed branches the initial growth of the first apical shoots is practically the same then the corresponding apical shoots on the control branches, wich are left without any pruning operation. Above all, on the basis of those two observations one is induced to think that the initial shoot vigour is not caused by nutritional causes only, following the more diffuse conception, but could be caused even by other factors and particularly by a mechanism of inhibition wich should be fixed in the buds allready before their opening, in relation with their position on the branch.

Nach der Versuchsergebnissen konnte festgestellt werden, dass die Keimung des Saatgutes von einigen Gemsearten durch die Anwendung des Gibberellins beschleunigt werden kann, und dass die Gibberellin nicht bei allen geprften Gemsearten wirksam ist.

42873859|I principali sintomi della disaffinit d'innesto fra il pero  Kaiser  ed il cotogno sono: 1) caratteristico sviluppo stentato del nesto  Kaiser , 2) accumulo di amido nel nsto e relativa carenza nel soggetto, 3) discontinuit fra i tessuti dei due bionti al punto d'innesto. Questi tre sintomi, comuni anche a molti altri casi di disaffinit, hanno dimostrato di non essere necessariamente legati ed interdipendenti tra loro; infatti, le indagini condotte nano messo in evidenza che ciascuno di essi pu manifestarsi da solo, oppure insieme ad uno od a tutti gli altri, a seconda della reciproca posizione che i due bionti disaffini vengono ad assumere con l'innesto. Sulla base di tali osservazioni, quindi, i sintomi suddetti sembrano probabilmente determinati da fattori diversi; pertanto, il quadro sintomatologico caratteristico di un determinato caso di disaffinit d'innesto potrebbe risultare pi o meno complesso perla concomitanza e la interazione di pi cause diverse. The main symptoms of the pear/quince uncongeniality are: 1) poor scions growth, 2) lack of the starch in the rootstock, 3) structural defects at the union. Comparing all the possible graft combinations between quince and pear  Kaiser , it has been stated that each one of the above mentioned symptoms may appear alone or joint with one or both the others in relation with the reciprocal position of the two uncongenial partners. It seems, therefore, that each symptom, often indipendent from the others, may probably occur because of a different factors interplay.

42873615|Gli AA. dopo avere fatto presenti le difficolt che si incontrano per combattere il M. ulmi, con i mezzi attualmente a disposizione, riportano i risultati ottenuti da varie prove effettuate sia alla fine dell'inverno, con ol gialli ed altri prodotti che agiscono sulle uova ibernanti, che su altre prove effettuate nel periodo primaverileestivo con acaricidi selettivi che agiscono sulle forme attive. Altre prove riguardano la selettivit degli stessi prodotti nei confronti degli insetti, siano essi nocivi o utili, che possono trovarsi sulle piante al momento del trattamento. Infine riportano i risultati ottenuti con prodotti sistemici somministrati alle piante per irrorazioni al terreno. Gli AA. nelle loro prove primaverili-estive, di proposito, non hanno impiegato prodotti fosforganici di sintesi poich sono del parere che oltre a non risultare molto efficaci, a causa di una certa assuefazione da parte degli acaridi, costituiscono un grave pericolo per i turbamenti e gli squilibri biologici che possono determinare con la soppressione della fauna utile. Gli AA. sono del parere che al momento attuale il migliore sistema per combattere il M. ulmi  quello di effettuare un trattamento invernale con ol gialli per cercare di devitalizzare il maggior numero possibile di uova, seguito nel caso e se ne presenti la necessit da uno o pi trattamenti con acaricidi selettivi in estate. Infine, gli AA. forniscono dei suggerimenti agli agricoltori sul come devono orientarsi nella lotta contro tutti gli artropodi nocivi per cercare di recare il minimo danno possibile agli insetti utili ed agli acari predatori. After pointing out the difficulty of fighting. M. ulmi with the ordinary means now available, the Authors survey the results obtained through a number of tests carried out by them the end of the winter season with yellow oils and other products acting on hibernating eggs, and also during the spring-summer period with selective acaricides acting on active forms of pests. Other tests were carried out with a view to investigating the selectivity of the same products in respect of both harmful and useful insects that can be found on the plants in the course of treatment. Further the Authors describe the results of experiments with systemic products conveyed to plants through toil-spraying. In the course of the spring-summer tests they did not deliberately employ any phospho-organic and synthetic products, as they are convinced that these products, in addition to having a restricted effectiveness owing to pests soon getting accustomed to them, are also a serious danger for the disturbance of the biological balance they can bring about through suppression of useful fauna. The Authors meintain that, for the time being, the best way of fighting M. ulmi in a winter-treatment with yellow oils intended to devitalize the largest possible number of hibernating, coupled, where necessary, with one or two more summertreatments with selective acaricides. The Authors conclude by giving advice to agriculturists as to how the fight of harmful arachnids should be conducted, in order to cause the smallest possible damage to useful insects and predatory mites.

42873154|L'A. riferisce sulle ricerche da lui compiute nel Veronese sul sistema radicale del pesco al fine di accertare se, in quel particolare ambiente, siano pi o meno giustificate talune pratiche colturali attuate in numerose aziende della zona. In seguito alla completa messa a nudo del sistema radicale di cinque alberi adulti, scelti in aziende nelle quali erano rappresentati i tipi di terreno caratteristici della provincia di Verona, I'A. pone in evidenza alcuni aspetti fondamentali del comportamento del sistema radicale del pesco in quella zona, e cio : a) la prevalente distribuzione delle radici in vicinanza della superficie, fenomeno accentuato dal limitato spessore del terreno agrario ; b) la grande espansione del sistema radicale al di fuori della superficie interessata dalla proiezione della chioma sul terreno, espansione proporzionalmente assai maggiore di quella che si riscontra in terreni di pi elevata fertilit e spessore ; c) il grande numero di anni che devono trascorrere prima che il sistema radicale di un pesco possa esplorare la zona occupata dalla ceppaia e dalle grosse radici di un pesco contiguo estirpato per le ragioni pi varie. L'A. ha poi osservato nei suoi rilievi che i sistemi radicali di due o pi alberi contigui non si incrociano, nel terreno, neppure a quote diverse, per cui ogni sistema radicale sembra vivere e svilupparsi in una determinata massa di terreno senza invadere la zona esplorata dalle radici dell'albero contiguo, per quanto vicino questo possa trovarsi. Ed ha accertato che, di conseguenza, quanto pi limitata  la distanza di piantagione lungo il filare, tanto maggiore  l'espansione delle radici verso il centro dell'interfilare. Tale fenomeno merita di essere ulteriormente studiato, in quanto non risulta finora segnalato da altri ricercatori. Sulla base delle osservazioni suesposte, ed anche a seguito di numerosi rilievi compiuti in diverse aziende rappresentative, I'A. conclude ponendo in evidenza taluni elementi negativi della tecnica di piantagione e di coltura del pesco nel Veronese ed indica le norme generali da seguire per il miglioramento della tecnica colturale e della produzione. The A. refers on its investigations on the peach roots distribution in the characteristic soils of the Verona province. On the basis of observations made in many representative farms and after the excavation of entire root system of five peach trees in different types of soil, the author puts particularly in evidence: a) the peach roots growth near under the surface of the ground, chiefly on account of the limited thickness of the ground itself; b) the root system, in this soils, goes far beyond the branch spread, about in the ratio of 3: 1; c) many years must elapsed before the roots of a peach tree can explore the soil explored by the stump and largest roots of a neighbouring peach tree, whatever the reason of the uprooting of this. The author also observed that each peach root system spreads in a definite zone of soil and its roots don't explore the soil that is explored by the roots of a neighbouring peach tree, even though very near established. Consequently, the more near are the trees along the row, the more the roots spread into the soil between the rows. On the basis of its observations the author discusses some practical suggestions in relation to the improvement of cultivation methods of the peach tree in Verona's province.
42873157|Nelle coltivazioni di garofano della zona di Pescia, si sono manifestate, in questi ultimi anni, delle alterazioni di una certa gravit che non erano mai state osservate in passato. Esse si sono presentate ed hanno mostrato i pi gravi sintomi durante i mesi primaverili ed hanno colpito le cultivars Venere, Elia, Remo, Withe Sim, William Sim, Claudia, nonch altre di minore interesse. I sintomi pi frequentemente osservati sono stati i seguenti: sulle foglie macchie rotondeggianti o lineari, dapprima clorotiche, poi necrotiche, interessanti tutto lo spessore del mesofillo o limitate ad una sola parte di esso. Sui fusti strie depresse e allungate e strozzature necrotiche su internodi erbacei. Il fiore  rimasto normale in tutti i casi osservati. Microscopicamente, in corrispondenza delle zone alterate, si  osservata la formazione di un tessuto ipertrofico privo o povero di cloroplasti, in seno al quale le cellule sono spesso andate incontro a necrosi, con conseguenti formazioni di linee brune o di ampi tratti disseccati. Le suddette alterazioni, in base alle osservazioni effettuate, non possono essere imputate a parassiti crittogamici, n, quasi sicuramente, a parassiti animali, o a cure colturali errate od a condizioni climatiche o pedologiche avverse, ma piuttosto fanno pensare ad alterazioni da virus. Da una ricerca bibliografica sulle virosi del garofano abbiamo infatti notato che la sintomatologia del nostro caso patologico assomiglia a quella provocata dal virus  Streak . Tentativi di trasmissione da piante malate a piante sane effettuati per innesto, per succo, per afidi, non ci hanno dato resultati soddisfacenti, non  per da escludere che ci sia dovuto ad una tecnica imperfetta usata nelle prove suddette. Sono in programma nuove indagini ampliate e modificate. Since a few years in the carnation plantations around Pescia a disease of a certain severity has appeared which had never before been observed. It occours or it is more serious during the spring months and it affects the cultivars Venere Elia, Remo, White Sim, William Sim, Claudia and other less important. The symptoms more frequently observed are: on the leaves round or linear spots chlorotic at first ; then necrotic, affecting the mesophyl through all its thickness, or only a portion of it. On the erbaceous internodes of the stems there are depressed and elongated streaks and necrotic shrinkages. The flowers as far as we have observed are normal. Section across the altered areas microscopically have shown an hypertrophie tissue with few or any cloroplasts at all, in this tissue the cells often become necrotic and dark lines or lacunas are further found. According to our findings these alterations cannot be imputed to any pathogen or, with every probability, to any pest or to any damage following cultural practices or unfavorable climatic or pedological conditions, everything points to virus induced alterations. From the literature on carnation virus diseases the symptoms we have observed appear very similar to  Streak . Efforts to transmit the disease to healthy plants by grafting, by juice inoculation and by aphids have not been successful; this perhaps is due to the technique employed. Futher research is still in progress.

42873840|Cambial temperatures in whitewashed and unpainted trunks of sweet orange young trees, daily recorded in summer over a period of four months (June 1st-September 30th, 1959), are reciprocally compared and related with the daily maximum of air temperature. Data summarized in the Tables 1, 2, 3, 4, indicate that: a) the cambium temperatures may reach very high levels in respect with the air temperatures; b) the cambium maxima temperatures of painted white trunks are lower than those detected, at the same time, in the unpainted trunks; c) whitewashing prevents the extreme daily fluctuations of the cambium temperature. Anatomical examination of the bark has shown a greater amount of  functioning phloem  in the painted white trunks, indicating a more efficient cambial activity. On the basis of those results the practical value of whitewashing trunks and branches in young or defoliated trees has been emphasized.

Sono stati altres rilevati i dati termometrici della zona presa in esame per i mesi da novembre a febbraio, nei 3 anni considerati ed  risultato che solo per poche ore, in alcuni anni, la temperatura minima scende al di sotto di 7 C. La pi forte percentuale di cascola  stata registrata per la cv.  Mayflower  con una media per i 3 anni dell'82%, seguita dalla cv.  Amsden  con il 79%, dalla cv.  Early-rose  con il 67%, dalla cv.  J. H. Hale  con il 55% e dalla  Morettini 1  con il 44%. Aprs avoir pass en revue les principales recherches excutes en Italie et  l'tranger au sujet des effets, sur le pches, des hautes tempratures hivernales en relation au phnomne du repos vgtatif prolong, et aprs avoir tudi les solutions possibles du problme, l'A. rapporte les rsultats de quelques recherches faites dans la provincie de Palerme, dans une zone caractrise par des tempratures hivernales trs leves. Les 5 cv. de pcher suivantes ont t examines :  Mayflower ,  Amsden ,  Early-rose ,  Morettini 1  et  J. H. Haie ; sur ces cv. on a dtermin le pourcentage, pour 3 Annes de suite, de la chute des bourgeons avant l'anthse, de l'poque et du dveloppement de la floraison. Les donnes thermomtriques de la zone examine ont t releves galement pour la priode comprise entre les mois de novembre et fvrier, au cours des 3 annes considres, et il en est rsult que pendant seulement quelques heures et certaines annes, la temprature minimum descend au dessous de 7 C. Le plus fort pourcentage de chute de bourgeons a t enregistr pour la cv.  Mayflower , avec une moyenne, pour les 3 annes, de 82%; alle est suivie par la cv.  Amsden  avec 79%, par la cv.  Early-rose  avec 67%, par la cv.  J. H. Hale  avec 55% et enfin par la cv.  Morettini 1  avec 44%. After having examined the most important researches carried out in Italy and abroad concerning the effects of high winter temperature on peach trees in relation to the phenomenon of prolonged dormancy, and concerning the possible solutions of this problem, the author reports on the results of research carried out in an area in the province of Palermo characterized by notably high winter temperature. Five peach tree cultivars were examined ( Mayflower ,  Amsden ,  Early-rose ,  Morettini 1 , and  J. H. Hale ); the percentages of buds falling before blossoming, and the time and state of the blossoming were determined for the mentioned cultivars during a three years period. The thermometrical data of the area-considered, for the periods November-February of the three years, were also noted, and disclosed that the minimum temperature falls below 7 C. (45 F) only for a few hours in some years. It was observed that the  Mayflower  cultivar had the highest bud-fall percentage, with an average fall of 82% for the three years, followed by the  Amsden  cultivar with 79%, the  Early-rose  cultivar with 67%, the  J. H. Hale  cultivar with 55%, and the  Morettini 1  cultivar with 44%.
42873846|L'A., nell'autunno del 1957, intraprese delle prove di lotta contro tre insetti particolarmente dannosi alle coltivazioni di carciofo in Sardegna : la Depressaria erinaceella Stgr., l'Hydroecia xanthenes Germ. e lo Sphaeroderma rubidum Gralls. Nella nota vengono riferiti i risultati conseguiti contro l'ultimo di questi. Le prove sono state condotte con prodotti a base di Endrin, Dieldrin, Rogor e con una miscela di parathion pi DDT. I dati raccolti, elaborati statisticamente, hanno accertato che i formulati a base di esteri fosforici sono quelli maggiormente indicati, permettendoci di conseguire (intervenendo principalmente contro le larve endofite dell'insetto) migliori risultati con un numero pi basso di trattamenti.  da tenere presente inoltre che l'impiego del Rogor ci consente d'intervenire efficacemente anche contro gli altri insetti che, in quello stesso periodo, attaccano la coltura. In the autumn of 1957 the Author entered upon a series of tests to combat three insects particularly dangerous for the artichoke cultivation in Sardinia : Depressaria erinaceella Stgr., Hydroecia xanthenes Germ. and Sphaeroderma rubidum Gralls. In this note the A. refers about the results achieved regarding the last of these. The tests were carried out using products conteining Endrin, Dieldrin, Rogor and a mixture of parathion plus DDT. The data collected (examined statistically) have shown that the formulas with same organic phosporous insecticides are the most effective since they give the best results (against the endofitic larvae of the insect) with a smaller number of treatments. It is further to be borne in mind that the use of Rogor also enables us to intervene efficaceously against the other insects which endanger the of artichoke cultivation during the same period.

42873703|La vigoria iniziale dei germogli emessi da semenzali di pesco innestati risulta tanto maggiore quanto pi precocemente questi ultimi vengono tagliati al disopra del punto di innesto. Prove comparative di taglio, degemmazione e decorticazione, eseguite in epoche diverse del periodo di riposo invernale, hanno confermato la probabile natura auxihica del fenomeno, nel quadro delle moderne interpretazioni relative al meccanismo di inibizione che determina il gradiente di vegetazione e la dominanza apicale dei germogli. I germogli emessi dalle gemme innestate ad occhio dormiente, lungo il fusto dei suddetti semenzali, hanno mostrato, per, di non seguire il gradiente di vegetazione del soggetto. Al contrario dei germogli di quest'ultimo, essi non hanno, infatti, risentito la diretta influenza dell'epoca in cui si esegue il taglio dei soggetti stessi in vivaio. Ci potrebbe essere forse attribuito ad una probabile incapacit degli inibitori di raggiungere la gemma innestata, attraverso il tessuto parenchimatico di cicatrizzazione. Nonostante questa iniziale indifferenza, i germogli del nesto hanno successivamente dimostrato uno sviluppo tanto maggiore, quanto pi tardi sono stati tagliati i soggetti. L'andamento del fenomeno, proporzionalmente inverso a quello manifestato dai germogli emessi dai soggetti stessi, induce al attribuirne le cause all'azione antagonistica esercitata da questi ultimi, sia per competizione nutrizionale, sia per ogni altra eventuale induzione di fenomeni inibitori secondari. Nei riguardi delle direttive tecniche  emersa, in conclusione, la pratica opportunit di ritardare quanto pi possibile l'esecuzione del taglio dei soggetti al di sopra del punto d'innesto. Ci, sia perch il conseguente minore sviluppo dei germogli del soggetto (e non del nestol) rende pi agevole e quindi pi economica la loro asportazione, sia perch si viene cos a favorire indirettamente lo sviluppo del nesto, evitandogli l'azione antagonistica di pi vigorosi germogli del soggetto. In one year  dormant budded  peach rootstock the initial growth of the shoots is so much vigorous as earlier the plant is cutted back above the union. This behaviour may be explained on tHe basis of the knowledges on the mechanism of growth inhibition and apical dominance. The vigor of the scion is not influenced by treatements (as pruning, girdling or disbudding) wich may modify the initial growth of the rootstock schoots. Probably because the growth inhibitor substances are not able to reach the scion bud through the parenchimatic tissues of the callus at the union. At the contrary, the scion growth results negatively influenced by the following rootstock shoots competition. Therefore, from a praticai point of view, it is confirmed the convenience to cut back the rootstocks, above the union, as late as possible. In this way, the rootstock shoots (but not the scion!) are weakened, their removal becomes easier, the scion having a better growth.
42873706|The A. refers about some preliminary investigations on the behaviour of oneyear old pear trees: A)-grafted with inverted rings of their own bark; B)-grafted with normally orientated rings, and C)-without ring grafts. Any significant difference has result between B)- and C)- groups in relation to the trees development, but highly significant differences have been found between A)- and B)- so as between A)- and C)- groups of trees. Histological investigations have shown that factors involved in the dwarfing effect depend upon the abnormal structure of the new Dhloem and the new xylem formed underneath the bark rings. The method of origin of those abnormal tissues structures is discussed in relation to the inverted  polarity  effects on the meristematic activity and on the differentiated tissues organisation.

Poche foglie sono comunque sufficienti per assicurare una regolare differenziazione delle gemme, nel mentre una totale mancanza delle stesse inibisce il detto processo. Flower bud induction and differentiation in the  Eriobotrya Japonica  have been studied by the microscopic and the gradual defoliation techniques. It has been shown that induction stimuli appear in the first ten days of May but attain their maximum efficiency in Juin for the early varieties and some weeks later for the late varieties. Also it has been shown: 1) The flowering stimulus is produced by leaves. 2) A little number of leaves is sufficient to assure a normal flower bud differentiation. Il a t dmontr aussi que mme dans le Nflier et pour les bourgeons terminaux, le stimulus de floraison est provoqu sans aucun doute par les feuilles.
