42874932|Osservazioni sono state effettuate per cinque anni, su 120 combinazioni di innesto e di sovrinnesto del pero su cotogno A. Sono stati presi in considerazione i caratteri vegetativi e produttivi con riguardo anche alle caratteristiche pomologiche dei frutti. I numerosi rilievi effettuati hanno permesso di giungere alle seguenti conclusioni: a) il sovrinnesto pu essere conveniente oltre che per le cultivar disaffini con il cotogno anche per quelle cultivar che, pur essendo innestate su tale portinnesto, presentano una eccessiva vigoria o ritardano nel mettersi a frutto; b) si raggiungono i migliori risultati quando le piante ottenute con il sovrinnesto presentano uno sviluppo ben equilibrato, ci che non sempre  attuabile se si utilizzano intermediari molto vigorosi o molto deboli; c) si deve in ogni caso tener presente che l'effetto dei vari intermediari non  costante per tutte le combinazioni di sovrainnesto, ma varia a seconda delle cultivar. Preliminary report on 120 doubleworking combinations of pear trees on quince A. Ten pear varieties directly worked on quince A or doubleworked each with twelve different intermediates, have been observed during a five years period. Observations have been done on the vegetative behaviour of the trees, and on their performance in relation to the fruiting habit. The following conclusions have been reached: a) Doubleworking is convenient not only to overcome the incompatibility that affects some varieties directly worked on the quince, but also in the case of those varieties that, on this rootstock, are too vigorous or delay their bearing ability. b) - the best results are reached when doubleworked trees show a well distributed development of the different branches or shoots. c) - the effect of the different intermediate is not constant, greatly varying with the variety worked on it.

42874937|Durante il periodo fine inverno-primavera del 1968 e del 1969 sono state osservate manifestazioni patologiche su gemme ed infiorescenze di peri in alcune localit italiane. Le manifestazioni della malattia erano rappresentate da:  imbrunimento e mancanza di schiusura di gemme,  necrosi pedicellari e peduncolari seguite da avvizzimento degli organi fiorali. Nell'analisi microbiologica del materiale raccolto si  constatata la presenza di pseudomonadi fluorescenti. La maggior parte degli isolati era riferibile a forme saprofite e solo alcune di esse sono state diagnosticate come tipi fitopatogeni della tassospecie Pseudomonas syringae. La mancanza di correlazione tra gli aspetti sintomatologici osservati nelle gemme e nelle infiorescenze e la presenza di Ps. syringae rende incerta l'eziologia delle alterazioni. Si discute la presenza di Ps. syringae come fattore patogenetico secondario. Diagnostic aspects of Pseudomonas syringae on pear trees. In pear-trees of some Italian countries during the 1968-69 Winter-Spring period, pathological symptoms on buds and inflorescences were observed. The main characteristics of the disease were:  browning and lack of opening of buds;  peduncles and pedicels necrosis followed by subseguent blight of flowers. The microbiological analysis of the available material showed the presence of fluorescent pseudomonads. Most of these isolates have been referred to saprophitic forms, while only a few have been recognized as pathogenic types of the Pseudomonas syringae taxospecies. The absence of a correlation between the Symptomatologie aspects observed in the inflorescences and in the buds, and the presence of Ps. syringae leads toward an uncertain ethiology of the alteration. The presence of Ps. syringae as secondary pathological factor is discussed.

42874817|La attivit dell'acqua di vegetazione delle olive  stata valutata mediante una serie di test biologici comprendenti: germinazione (cocomero), accrescimento di radici ed ipocotili (cocomero), senescenza di porzioni di foglia (fagiolo ed orzo) ed abscissione (fagiolo, pomodoro e ciliegia). Sia la germinazione che l'accrescimento sono stati fortemente ridotti alle concentrazioni di 50 e 100 mg/ml. Questa inibizione  stata tuttavia temporanea giacch il materiale ha mostrato una ripresa dello sviluppo quando trasferito in substrati privi di acqua di vegetazione. La senescenza di porzioni fogliari, misurata come variazione del contenuto in clorofilla,  stata ritardata dai trattamenti con acqua di vegetazione. Tale ritardo  probabilmente da correlare alla presenza di zuccheri e sostanze minerali nel substrato. Spray fogliari (5 mg/ml) hanno causato una forte riduzione della resistenza al distacco in ciliegie acide (Montmorency). Greater abscission activity was found in old (62% reduction of fruit removal force) than in young (16% reduction) cherry fruit expiants. Similar results were found for tomato fruit expiants. When the crude OWF was chromatographed on paper using isopropanol-ammonia-water (10-1-1 v/v) as the developing solvent, two broad areas of inhibition (elongation of wheat coleoptile segments) were noted; one at Rf 0,0-0,4 and the other at Rf 0,5-0,9.

42874947|The effects of "Beurr Giffard", "Butirra precoce Morettini", "Starkrimson", "Dr Guyot", "Comice" and "Beurr Clairgeau" as intermediates for doubleworked pear varieties have been studied in relation to the specific rate of transpiration, to the total amount of transpiration and to the growth of four varieties ("Clapp's Favourite", "Anjou", "William" and "Kaiser") The main results have been as follows : 1) some intermediates, like "Beurr Giffard", reduced the rate of the specific transpiration of the different varieties, while others, like "Dr. Guyot", increased it; on the contrary, the total transpiration of each variety has been reduced or increased by the different intermediate ("Starkrimson" and "Butirra precoce Morettini" respectively). 2) tree growth of the different varieties has been modified by double-working, but no direct relationship exists between the rate of specific transpiration and growth, which are generally indipendent and modified in different directions by the intermediate stem-piece used; on the contrary, a positive correlation exists between the total transpiration and the growth of varieties; this correlation appears susceptible to be modified in the same direction by the same intermediate. Starting from these results, the Authors discuss the double-working practical application to regulate the growth and the water balance of some pear varieties as regards the ecological conditions were they are grown.

"Gentile delle Langhe", "Nocchione", "Nocchia Rosa" e "Tonda Romana", hanno avuto un esito poco soddisfacente avendo le percentuali massime di radicazione raggiunto livelli non superiori al 25% nella cv. Tuttavia  stato possibile trarre alcune considerazioni di carattere orientativo quali ad es. l'inefficacia del solo trattamento termico, la probabile maggiore azione dell'NAA rispetto all'IBA, l'opportunit di usare a l'NAA concentrazioni superiori a quelle impiegate, ecc. Gli AA concludono che ulteriori approfondite indagini sono necessarie prima che tale tecnica possa esere eventualmente impiegata o definitivamente esclusa per la propagazione del nocciolo su scala vivaistica. Trials on hazel propagation by hardwood cuttings with bottom heat are referred. Results on "Gentile delle Langhe", "Nocchione", "Nocchia Rosa" and "Tonda Romana" varieties, were not very satisfactory, since the best rooting percentages were as much as 25% in "Gentile delle Langhe  and 41% in "Nocchia Rosa". Nevertheless it was possible to get some useful considerations regarding to: weak influence of temperature treatments alone; probable better activity of NAA in comparison to IBA; necessity to test NAA at higher concentrations, etc. More detailed experiments are needed before giving any final judgement about the possibility of introducing these techniques in nursery practices.

Cette recherche de plants sains se manifeste aussi bien en culture fruitire (pommier) que dans le domaine du fraisier. Aspects of nursery production in Belgium. Belgian fruit nurseries have a number of characteristics which the speaker develops successively along the lines proposed to him. 1) They are concentrated in the north of the country, a region with light soil and a maritime climate. 2) 20 years ago they experienced a slump when standard-trees orchards disappeared; they are at present feeling the repercussion of the Common Market fruit slump. 3) They maintain an export figure (mainly to Holland and Germany) which represents a not negligible part of their production. 4) On the whole they are of a typicaly family nature and their average area seldom exceeds 2 ha. 5) They are difficult to characterize as regards the equipment they use (cf. their family nature). 6) They endeavour, however, to follow the evolution of modern techniques, and there is certainly vitality in our orcharding. 7) They are most often of the mixed typs, i.e. the nurseryman produces ornamental and fruit bushes or trees and or forest trees. 8) They mostly grow apple and pear trees, the number of varieties of which is diminishing year by year. 9) They attach a not negligible importance to the multiplication of strawberry plants, of which only 10 to 15% (about 10 to 15 million plants) are bought in the trade, the rest being obtained by the strawberry-grower himself from plants that have borne fruit. 10) They attach a lot of importance to control of production, especially as regards plants free from virus disease, a field in which our country has made efforts worthy of mention. This seeking after healthy plants is evidenced both as regards apple trees and as regards strawberry plants.

Since 1960 there has been, on the other hand, a progressive set-back in nursery activity (2813 hectares in 1967) which in 1968 went through a particularly grave crisis. Thanks to this possibility of supplying plants of high quality and thanks also to the probable development of new plants which have a high density per hectare, French nurseries can look confidently towards the future. The production of strawberry plants, organised by the officially controlled National Syndicate of Strawberry Plants Producers, in subject to the control of the Official Control Service; this increases in importance from year to year (24 million plants in 1968). Fruit-tree breeding in The Netherlands is almost entirely directed towards self-sufficiency of our fairly extensive national industry. Both exports and imports of fruit trees and strawberry plant material are of minor importance, compared with those of other arboricultural material. Consequently such varieties and rootstocks of pome and stone fruits are grown as are demanded by the Dutch fruit industry. Although the number of pome and stone fruit varieties is still large, only a few varieties are really important. With apple, the leading varieties are Golden Delicious, Cox's Orange Pippin, James Grieve, Red Jonathan and Schone van Boskoop; with pear, the varieties Conference, Charneux and Doyenn du Comice; with plum, the varieties Victoria and Ontario; with cherry, the varieties Morelle, Early Rivers and Meikers. In 1967 the total area of fruit production was over 47,000 ha., of which 68% was planted with apples, 22% with pears, and the remaining 10% with plums, cherries and peaches. The number of enterprises in The Netherlands concerned with fruit production has decreased considerably in recent years (1963: 34,500; 1967: 23,500) and it is expected that again some 10,000 enterprises will abandon fruit growing in the coming years, as a consequence of further rationalization and mechanization and an increase in scale. Due to a more intensive cultivation technique  more trees per ha  the area annually replanted with pome and stone fruits decreases steadily, not however the number of trees that are replanted. The number of tree nurseries in The Netherlands is about 3,000 of which 500 are concerned with the growing of fruit trees and rootstocks, with a total cultivated area of about 55 ha. Most of the tree nurseries in our country are small holdings, where as much as possible family labour is employed and work is mechanized. As already stated, fruit tree breeding in The Netherlands is geared to production for the home market, so that the varieties encountered in the tree nurseries are practicall the same as those grown on the fruit farms. Plants of the genera Malus, Pyrus and Prunus may be freely imported into our country from October 10 to April 15, provided the shipments are accompanied by a certificate of the foreign Phytopathological Service concerned showing that the plants are free from San Jos scale (Quadraspidiotus perniciosus Comst.) and the bacterial disease fire blight (Erwinia amylovora (Burrill) Winslow et al.) and from infection by the virus disease plum pox (Sharka). The economic importance of the production of ornamentals, including the production of plant material of fruit trees, is high in The Netherlands compared with that in other countries, namely 1% of the national income. In our country the organization system for the production of ornamental crops is centralized; besides the Ministry of Agriculture and Fisheries, public corporations, such as the Agricultural Board, the Trade Organizations and Marketing Boards, Control and Inspection Services, play a part. Strawberries: in 1968 over 2600 ha of strawberries were grown out-of-doors and 240 ha under glass in The Netherlands. The production value of one ha under glass is ten times that of one ha in the open. In the Netherlands a plot of strawberries is generally no longer retained than for two years. For new plantations 40 million plants are annually required. Every year about 10 million true-breeding, virus-free strawberry plants  certified by the N.A.K.-B.  are supplied to pratice as basic material. The leading varieties are Gorella, Senga Sengana, Redgauntlet and Glasa. Interest in everbearing varieties is increasing in our country.

Il faut cependant tenir compte, dans ces recherches statistiques, du fait qu'il s'agit, quant aux exportations allemandes (mises  part vers l'Autriche, la Belgique, le Luxembourg et la Suisse) surtout de semences de base de haute valeur, et quant aux importations, il s'agit principalement des semences de vente, reproduites  l'tranger,  partir de semences de base allemandes. Les semences allemandes doivent faire face  une concurrence des plus en plus grande des importations trangres. Comme suite du dveloppement, des fusions on lieu, en ce moment, entre les maisons de selection de semences. En plus de la concentration et de la rationalisation qui y est lie, la production de semences de la plus haute qualit (entre autre pour le semis monograine) devrait tre  l'avenir, plus au premier plan des intrts, qu'elle ne l'a t jusqu' prsent. Vegetable-seed-produciion has a long tradition in Germany, and, until the First World War and later, possessed a worldwide reputation. However, markets were lost through political events, the continuity of breeding was disturbed, and many growers were deprived of their favourable sites, their capital, and experienced staff, through the emigration to West Germany. After the rebuilding in West Germany, practically only basic seed is propagated by the German home breeders, whereas the commercial seed is produced in climatically favourable areas abroad. Favourite propagation areas are Italy (especially for biennial species like carrot, onion, leek, beetroot, celery etc.), the Netherlands (spinach, carrot etc.), and the Balcan States. Leguminosae have, for several years, been favoured for propagation in North and East Africa. When the Common Market import duties were lowered at the beginning of the 1960's, German breeders began to renounce registration and the custom-free import of their foreign propagation and to import their seeds, after two or three propagations abroad, as " imported seed ". Since then, information about propagation areas abroad has been incomplete, and exact details about size and site are not available. Aspects of the choice of propagation areas are discussed and the organisation of seed production in West Germany described. The trade figures for vegetable seeds designate West Germany as a seed-importing country. However, when considering these statistics, it should be taken into account that German exports are mainly concerned (except to Austria, Belgium-Luxemburg and Switzerland) with high-value basic seed, and imports mainly with standard seed from German basic Seed propagated abroad. German seed is exposed to increasing competition through foreign imports. As a consequence, amalgamations are taking place at present amongst German seed firms. Besides the concentration, and the rationalisation connected with it, the propagation of highest quality seed (amongst others for the single corn deposit) will in the future be even more in the foreground of interest than before.

The highly developed vegetable culture in the Netherlands finds an important support in the breeding work of the Dutch seed industry. This breeding work is stimulated by fundamental research work of Governmental Institutes and by the granting of Breeders Rights. Spectacular improvements in the assortment of varieties can be indicated. The breeding of new varieties and the vegetable seed-production is in hands of qualified private seed firms. There is a close cooperation with scientific institutes. Breeding work is still strongly intensifying. All activities of the seed producers and seed traders are supervized, according to an adequate system, by an Inspection Service (N.A.K.G.), duly authorized by the Ministry of Agriculture on basis of the seed-law. Registration of all seed producers and seed distributors is obliged. There is no obligatory certification scheme and no restrictive list of varieties accepted for distribution. Much value is set on the control of struely labelling and on the yearly revised list of recommended varieties.
42878113|Aprs une rapide introduction dans laquelle l'auteur montre l'utilit de la protection juridique des obtentions vgtales, il expose les difficults d'ordre philosophique et juridique qui se sont opposes jusqu' une poque trs rcente  l'adoption d'une lgislation spcifique pour protger les droits des crateurs de nouvelles espces ou varits de plantes. Ce n'est que depuis l'adoption de la Convention de Paris du 2 Dcembre 1961 que le droit de l'obtenteur est solennellement reconnu et dot d'un Statut juridique prcis. Dans une deuxime partie il examine deux problmes qui se posent dans ce domaine : Tout d'abord l'absence actuelle de lien entre la Convention de Paris et le March Commun, puis le problme du cot pour l'obtenteur de la protection. Dans sa conclusion l'auteur exprime son vif espoir que l'ITALIE se joindra bientt aux autres Etats qui ont ratifi la Convention, car l'agriculture italienne en tirera certainement un grand bnfice. L'auteur a joint dans une premire annexe le texte de la Convention de Paris du 2 Dcembre 1961. Dans une deuxime annexe il donne un rapide aperu des lgislations dj en vigueur dans ce domaine ou sur le point d'tre mises en oeuvre dans divers pays. The Author of the Report introduces his subject by emphasizing the usefulness of legal protection for new  constitutions  in the field of cultivated plants : then he proceeds to enumerate the difficulties of principle and of legal character that, up to very recent times, have prevented the adoption of statutory rules which could protect the rights of the developers of new varieties, rights which were solemnly recognized and given a precise legal standing by the Paris Convention of December 2, 1961. The Author then proceeds to examine some fundamental problems connected with the subject, and in particular the as yet non-existent relations between the Paris Convention and the Common Market, and the problem of the cost involved in obtaining protection today. In conclusion, the Author is strongly of the view that Italy should, as soon as possible, join the other countries which have ratified the Paris Convention, and expresses his conviction that Italian agriculture cannot fail to derive considerable benefits from such action. Attached to the report is the full text of the Paris Convention and a brief but useful review of the Statutory Rules on this subject already existing or on the point of being adopted in the various countries.

42877652|Peach trees of the free stone varieties "Redhaven", "Dixigem", "Southland", "Cardinal" and "Coronet" and of the cling varieties "Amarillo de Agosto 2", "Vivian" and "Campiel", were sprayed with "CCC" at 4000 ppm, three times starting from 20 May to 20 July 1968. The following results have been reached: 1) in the year of treatments, "CCC" increased the total number of fruit buds on "Dixigem", "Cardinal" and "Campiel", but the total amount of leaf buds was not affected; 2) the fruit buds on treated trees of varieties "Dixigem", "Southland" and "Cardinal" were much less damaged by winter frost, and, consequently, the flowering in the following spring were higher; 3) in the next season the fruiting quality were positively affected by "CCC" in the case of the varieties "Dixigem" "Cardinal" and "Coronet"; this character was not examinated in cling peach varieties. On the basis of these results, the Authors discuss the "CCC" practical application on peach trees, in view to regulate their vegetative and productive behaviour as regards the response of the diffrents varieties to "CCC" and to the ecological conditions.

42877654|Researches carried out in 1968 and 1969 on twelve-year-old walnut trees have shown that, like the other stone fruits, walnut fruits exibit a double sigmoid growth curve. The rate of growth decreases during the pit-hardening, i.e. the date when the tip of the pit begins to harden, corresponds to the date at wich the fruits enter the period of slow growth. During this period sensible modifications begin in the chemical composition of the fruits: there is a continuous decrease of the moisture and a steady increase of ash potassium and nitrogen.

42877656|L'impiego di un indice di raccolta basato sul rapporto residuo secco reirattometrico/acidit totale consente di conoscere, al momento dell'immagazzinamento, con un limite di probabilit dell'80%, se le pere Passa Crassana saranno soggette all'imbrunimento interno nel corso della conservazione. La validit del metodo, avendo operato su quatit massive di prodotto di diversa provenienza,  stato statisticamente dimostrato. The possibility that "Passa Crassana "pears may be subjected to internal browning during storage can be predicted by using ripening index based on refractometer index/total acidity ratio, within range of 80% of probability. The method has been demonstrated statistically reliable by checking it on bulk amounts of the product from different sources.
42877657|Si  studiato l'effetto di due temperature (17 e 23 C) sulla manifestazione della partenocarpia in una linea di cetriolo da sottaceto. Si  osservato che lo sviluppo partenocarpico dei frutti avviene regolarmente a 17 mentre a 23 i frutti non impollinati non sono in grado di svilupparsi. Sembra confermato che la formazione di frutti partenocarpici aumenti passando da nodi basali verso quelli superiori. Nella cella a 17 i frutti impollinati si sviluppano pi rapidamente di quelli non impollinati e forniscono produzioni totali significativamente superiori. The effect of two levels of temperature (17 and 23 C) on the manifestation of parthenocarpy in a pickling cucumber line has ben studied in the controlled environment of the phytothrone of the Horticultural plant Breeding Institute (Wageningen - Holland). Parthenocarpical development of fruits appeared to occur regulary at 17C while 23C unimpollinated fruits did not grow up. Results seem to confirm that setting of parthenocarpical fruits increases from basal nodes to the upper ones. At 17C degrees pollinated fruits did grow faster that unimpollinated ones and appeared to yield significantly more.

About 6,000 selected replies have been processed by a computer, according to a programme able to lead the optional opinions of the visitors, classified in order to their age, sex and activity. Conclusions have been drawn of interest for marketing and fruit breeding.

42877675|Two Italian apricot varieties, " Reale d"Imola " and " Precoce d'Imola " were tested on ten different rootstocks. Five of them were P. myrobolana (" belgian ", " 1/14 ", " Bautlende ", " de Lesdain ", " white "), two apricot seedlings (" Canino " and " Mech-Mech "), two peach seedlings (" Missour " and " A/VI ") and, at last, "Rigotti 1/II " seedling (P. persica  P. davidiana ?). The field trial has been carried out in a typical foot-hill apricot area of Emilia-Romagna region. During the first three years it was observed a very different behaviour of the rootstocks in relation to their genetical source, to the rate of incompatibility and to the interaction with the scions. " Reale d'Imola " trees were more vigorous than " Precoce d'Imola ", but the latter came to bear more rapidly. " Rigotti 1/II " showed a complete incompatibility (confirmed by an anatomical investigation) with both apricot varieties, while the " Mech-Mech " seedlings did'nt give good results with " Reale dimola " owing to the high percentage of grafting failures. It was found a very great heterogeneity among the five myrobolan varieties: " belgian " induced either vigorous and earliest bearing trees; other myrobolans (e.g. " Lesdain ") induced high growth of the scions too, but trees came to bear later; " white " myrobolan gave the smallest trees and the lowest crop. On " Canino " apricot seedlings, trees showed good growth as well as on " A/VI " peach seedlings (grafted with " Reale dimola "); they got out an early bearing also and bigger fruits than those obtained from the trees on some myrobolans (" Lesdain " and " Bautlende "). Another way to estimate the " tree efficiency " was the ratio between the fruit yield and the trunk cross-section area, that showed a good efficiency of the " Precoce d'Imola " trees grafted on " belgian " and " 1/14 " myrobolans as much as those on " A/VI " peach seedlings and on " Canino " apricot seedlings.

42877677|Si  studiata la topologia dei fiori ermafroditi in piante intere di melone Charentais allevate in serra su corde. Si  visto che i fiori perfetti compaiono sui primi due nodi dei rami secondari e terziari, con frequenza proporzionale all'altezza d'inserzione di tali rami sul ramo primario: questa regola non viene fondamentalmente alterata n dalla cimatura, n dall'asportazione delle foglie, n dalla moltiplicazione vegetativa. Si suggerisce che la comparsa dei fiori perfetti sia dovuta alla presenza di particolari ormoni nella pianta adulta, e si prospetta la possibilit di anticiparne l'emissione utilizzando per l'impianto materiale moltiplicato per talea da piante gi in produzione. Topology of perfect flowers in unpruned plants of cataloupe Charentais grown up strings in glasshouse has been studied. Perfect flowers appear on the first two nodes of the secondary and tertiary branches, their number increasing with increasing height of the branching on the primary stem: this rule was not substantially altered by removal of the terminal bud or of the leaves, nor by vegetative multiplication. Anticipated production of perfect flowers was obtained planting cuttings from yielding plants. It is suggested that production of perfect flowers is due to hormonal factors.
42877678|Gli Autori hanno condotto una prova per esaminare l'accumulo dei nitrati (N-NO) in Cichorium endivia L. latifolium Hegi in relazione alla concimazione azotata, formulata con diverse forme di azoto (solfato di ammonio, nitrato di calcio, urea, nitrato di ammonio) e con diverse dosi delle singole forme (0, 120, 180, 240 kg N/ha). L'analisi dei nitrati  stata effettuata secondo il metodo Woolley e al. (15) sulla sostanza secca (calcolata per singoli trattamenti) di diverse parti della pianta: cuore (costituito esclusivamente dalle foglie bianche), picciolo e lembo fogliare delle foglie esterne del cespo completamente verdi. I risultati hanno messo in evidenza che l'accumulo dei nitrati nelle diverse parti  diverso: risulta maggiore nel picciolo, minore nel lembo fogliare e minimo nel cuore. In generale a dosi pi elevate di azoto corrispondono contenuti maggiori dei nitrati solo nel picciolo, non nel cuore e nel lembo fogliare. Le varie forme di azoto non influiscono in maniera significativamente diversa sulla produzione. A trial has been carried out to examine the nitrate accumulation in Cichorium endivia L. Itifolium Hegi by applying different types of nitrogen fertilizers (Ammonium sulphate, calcium nitrate, urea, ammonium nitrate) in different amounts (0, 120, 180, 240 kg N/ha).. Nitrate was analysed according to Wolley et al (15) in dry matter of all treatments for tree parts of the plants: heart, formed by white leaves, stalk and blades of the external green leaves. The nitrate accumulation was different in the different parts of the plant: higher in the leaf stalk, lower in the leaf blade, lowest in the heart. Increasing nitrogen fertilization increases nitrate accumulation only in the stalk of the green external leaves, not in the heart and in the leaf blade. The different types of nitrogen fertilizers did not influence the nitrate accumulation. The results of the production are referred. The production was influenxed by different amounts of nitrogen fertilizers not by different types of nitrogen fertilizer.
42877679|Si riferiscono i risultati di una prova di pacciamatura con films plastici effettuata in carciofo cv. " Violetto di Toscana " in coltura asciutta in localit " Vada " nel 1968. Queste le tesi adottate in uno schema a blocchi randomizzati con 4 ripetizioni. 1) Testimone non pacciamato; 2) Pacciamatura con film nero di Polietilene (0,15 mm di spessore); 3) Pacciamatura con film trasparente (0,15 mm di spessore) in Polietilene e diserbo con Camparol 1817 (3 kg/ha); 4) Diserbo con " Camparol 1817 ". (3 kg/ha) L'effetto dei due tipi di pacciamatura non  risultato significativamente diverso, tuttavia quella con film trasparente  apparsa superiore grazie al maggiore anticipo ed anche al diserbante che ha controllato perfettamente le infestanti. L'impiego del film trasparente ha permesso rispetto al testimone un anticipo di 4,2 giorni nella raccolta del 1 capolino e di 5,2 giorni nella raccolta del 4 capolino. Il numero totale dei capolini per pianta  stato aumentato da 15,7 a 19,9. Results of a mulching trial with plastic films on artichoke cv. " Violetto di Toscana" are referred. The treatments in randomized scheme with four repetition are the followings: 1) Test no mulched. 2) Mulching with black film of polyethylene (0,15 mm of thickness). 3) Mulching with transparent film of polyethylene (0,15 mm of thickness) and weed control with Camparol 1817 (3 kg/ha) 4) Weed control with Camparol 1817 (3 kg/ha). The effect of the two types of mulching are not resulted significantly different, however the treatment with transparent film appeared superior for the earliness. The Camparol 1817, has determined a good weed control. The mulching with transparent film determined earliness of 4,2 days in the harvest of the 1st head and 5,2 days in the harvest of the 4th head, with respect to Test. The total number of heads for plant increased from 15,7 to 19,9.
42877680|La Sesia del ribes provoca in Romagna, gravi danni alle colture di kaki scavando gallerie subcorticali nel tronco e nei rami principali. Dai primi studi effettuati sulla biologia dell'insetto risulta che gli sfarfallamenti iniziano in maggio e terminano in settembre, interessando cos un periodo di circa cinque mesi. Fra i metodi di lotta sperimentati, i migliori risultati sono stati ottenuti con trattamenti insetticidi al tronco e ai rami principali, nel periodo estivo durante la nascita delle larve, con Parathion da solo o unito a Lindano. Riguardo al numero di trattamenti su piante molto danneggiate, si consigliano almeno tre interventi annui da effettuarsi rispettivamente nella prima decade di giugno, nella prima decade di luglio e verso la seconda met di agosto. Per piante poco infestate saranno sufficienti due trattamenti annui da effettuarsi rispettivamente in giugno e in luglio. Coi trattamenti si ottengono risultati veramente positivi solo se si bagnano i tronchi e i rami bene e con abbondante soluzione insetticida, aggiungendo un po' di bagnante per facilitare la penetrazione del liquido nelle anfrattuosita della corteccia. Risultati soddisfacenti contro l'insetto si ottengono anche con raschiature e spezzolature ai tronchi a fine inverno, seguite da trattamenti insetticidi. The Currant Clearwing Moth (Synanthedon tipuliformis Cl.) cause heavy ravages to kaki cultivations in Romagna (Italy), by boring tunnels under the bark of trunks and of main branches. The emergence of the adults begins in May and ends in September, so it concerns a period of about five mouths. Among the methods of fight tried, the best results have been obtained by the application of spray insecticides, Parathion only or mixed with Lindane, to the trunk and to the main branches, in Summer during the birth of the larvae. As for the number of treatments on very damaged plants, three yearly treatments at least, are advisable. The must be effected in the first ten days of June, in the first ten days of July, and in the second half of August, respectively. Two yearly treatments, which must be effected in June and July, will be enough for not very damaged plants. Really good results can be obtained by the application of spray insecticides only if trunks and branches are thoroughly sprinkled with abundant insecticidal solution. Satisfactory results in the control of this insect can also be obtained by scraping and brushing trunks at the end of Winter, followed by the application of spray insecticides.

42877686|Morphological, biological and commercial characteristics of the new cultivar of sweet cherry " Vittoria " (" Moretta di Cazzano "  " Durona di Padova ") originated in Verona, Italy, by G. Bargioni, Verona's Experiment Institut for Fruit Growing, are described. The most important characteristics of " Vittoria " are : a) all the cherries ripen at the same time (second half of June) and, b) at ripening time, the fruit removal force (FRF) has a very low value and all the cherries fall very easy, without the pedicel, in consequence of shaking of the branches; the point of insertion of the pedicel on the fruit, at the abscission level, remains suberised. For that, " Vittoria " seems to be able to give an important help to the solution of the problem of mechanical harvesting of sweet cherries.
42877687|La fruttificazione di alcune specie da frutto (pesco, albicocco, ecc.) viene talvolta compromessa da gelate tardive durante il periodo di fioritura. Allo scopo di saggiare l'azione di alcuni fitoregolatori sulla schiusura delle gemme a fiore, sono state condotte alcune prove sulle cultivar di pesco " Cardinal " e " Dixired ". I trattamenti sono stati eeffettuati alla met di ottobre, prima della caduta delle foglie. Sono stati impiegati 3 composti alle seguenti concentrazioni: Alar 2000-4000-6000 ppm; Idrazide maleica 500-1000-1500 ppm; NAA 500-1000-1500 ppm. I risultati conseguiti, nelle condizioni in cui sono state condotte le prove, possono cos essere sintetizzati: su entrambe le cultivar l'NAA a tutte le concentrazioni ha ritardato la data di piena fioritura di un periodo variabile da 1 a 2 giorni e mezzo. Lo stesso risultato  stato ottenuto nella " Cardinal " anche con l'Alar a 6000 ppm. L'NAA, alle concentrazioni pi elevate, ha provocato, sia sulla " Cardinal " che sulla " Dixired " danni alle foglie pi giovani ed ai rami non completamente lignificati. Le piante trattate con questo composto hanno mostrato un notevole ritardo nella caduta delle foglie, una minore percentuale di fiori schiusi ed infine una pi bassa fruttificazione. Anche i trattamenti con Alar hanno determinato una riduzione della produzione. In generale i fitoregolatori impiegati non hanno mostrato di influenzare sensibilmente l'attivit vegetativa delle piante. Fruit production (e.g. peaches and apricots) is frequently damaged by late frost during blossom period. Some growth regulators were tested as for their effectiveness in delayng blossoming. Peach trees (cv. " Cardinal " and " Dixired ") were sprayed in middle October, when leaves were still green, with Alar (2000-4000-6000 ppm., MH (500-1000-1500 ppm.). and NAA (500-1000-1500 ppm.). Under the conditions of this trial it was found : all concentrations of NAA used on both varieties delayed blossoming only two days. The same results were obtained using Alar, 6000 ppm., on " Cardinal ". NAA (on both varieties at higher concentrations) damaged the young leaves and the immature parts of shoots, delayed leaves fall and decreased the flowering percentage. Generally, all the trees sprayed with NAA or Alar produced lower yelds. The growth of the treated shoots not showed particular secondary effects.

42877693|Gli Autori hanno esaminato, sotto il profilo istologico, la struttura del fusto in astoni di melo " Golden Delicious " trattati con TIBA a 1.000 ppm all'inizio della stagione vegetativa. I principali effetti del trattamento sono rappresentati dalla formazione di una maggiore quantit di corteccia e, per quanto riguarda il legno, dalla presenza di bande concentriche di legno di tensione, con vasi pi piccoli e meno numerosi. In base a questi rilievi gli Autori concludono mettendo in rilievo la minor efficienza del sistema conduttore delle piante trattate. Anatomical investigations have been performed on the stem of " Golden Delicious " maiden trees treated, during early summer, with TIBA (1.000 ppm). This treatment stimulated bark development, with special reference to the cortex, and determined the formation of a less porous xylem, provided with few and small vessels and characterized by the presence of some continuous rings of tension wood. On the basis of these observations the reduced conductivity of the stem in the treated plants is emphasized.
42877694|Researches have been carried out, in 1969-70, on thermic requirements of 3-yearsold filberts, ccvv. " Mansa ", " Rampolla ", " S. Maria di Ges ", grown in pots. Temperature requirements have been evaluated by the exponential system. Two methods have been applied for the evaluations of chilling requirements: the sum of the exponential actions and the sum of the temperatures (this second method values the amount of low temperatures by the number of hours below 7C). These researches have provided data which led us to draw the following conclusions:  The typical relation between " heat units " and " cold units " is an exponential curve.  In plants of " S. Maria di Ges " and " Rampolla " budded on rootstock " S. Maria di Ges ", the chilling requirements were higher than the ones observed in suckers of " S. Maria di Ges "and " Mansa ".  The chilling requirements of staminate flowers were considerably lower than those of leaf buds and pistillate flowers.  Generally, pistillate flowers have very low heat requirements. Peculiar aspects of the pollen germination, of the growth of the pollen tubes in the style and of the evolution of female gametophyte in conditions of lack of adequate chilling, have been also examined.

42877701|Gli AA. esposta l'evoluzione verifcatasi nell'ultimo quindicennio della coltura del pesco, nel suo standard varietale nazionale e nella sua produzione; nell'intento di intensificare l'ancora deficiente raccolta di pesche nei mesi di maggio e giugno, pi agevolmente commerciabili, descrivono sommariamente le numerose cultivar  Extraprecoci  e  Precocissime  che si prestano allo scopo. Le prime comprendono le cultivar che maturano i frutti prima della "May Flower", le seconde quelle che maturano fra la "May Flower" e la "Dixired". Delle  Extraprecoci  sono considerate n. 18 cultivar fra le pi note e n. 8 delle meno note. Delle  Precocissime  ne vengono descritte n. 19 fra le prime e n. 10 delle seconde. Delle pi note, di entrambi i gruppi,  indicata: l'origine, l'epoca della loro diffusione, le principali caratteristiche agronomiche e commerciali, con particolare riguardo al fabbisogno in freddo, l'epoca della fioritura e della maturazione dei frutti. Nelle Tabb. n. 4 e 5 sono state riassunte tutte le suddette caratteristiche per ciascuna delle 55 cultivar descritte. Queste caratteristiche consentono ai peschicoltori di poter scegliere, fra le pi precoci, quelle che si prestano per essere coltivate nelle zone pi calde del nostro Paese, nelle quali  possibile produrre pesche a partire dalla met di maggio, in condizioni ordinarie d'ambiente ed ai primi di maggio in colture protette. Si anticipa vantaggiosamente in tal modo il ciclo produttivo del pesco. Sono infine indicate fra le  Extraprecoci  le cultivar pi promettenti, disposte in ordine di maturazione e cio: "Flordasun" e "Flordawon" (limitatamente alle zone con climi invernali molto miti), "Vhynot", "Royal Gold", "Springtime", "Armgold", "Springold" (pi adatta per le zone Centro-Settentrionali), "Favorita I Morettini", "Merrill May Lady" e "Earlibelle" da coltivare nelle regioni pi calde dell'Italia. Fra le  Precocissime  vengono consigliate le seguenti: "Favorita II Morettini", "Merrill Bonjour", "Springerest ", "Favorita III Morettini", "Desertgold", "Collins , "Merrill Gemfree 1", "June Gold" (limitatamente negli ambienti pi confacenti). In considerazione della mutevole variabilit degli ambienti che caratterizzano anche il nostro Meridione e le Isole, prima di utilizzare le suddette cultivar per impianti di pescheti industriali,  necessario, in special modo per le cultivar a fioritura molto precoce, sperimentarle in precedenza. The Authors expose the last fifteen years' evolution of the peach culture, of its national varietal standard and of its production. They intend to intensify the actually deficient yeld of peaches in may and june, just when they are easily marketable. So they give a brief description of the "Extraearly" and "Earliest" varieties, particularly suitable for this aim. In the first group they include the varieties ripening before "May Flower" and in the second those ripening between "May Flower" and "Dixired". In the first group 18 of the best-known varieties and 8 of the less-known are considered; in the second are described 19 best-known and 10 less-known varieties. For both these groups and for the best-known varieties are indicated: origin, date of diffusion, principal agronomic and commercial characters with special reference to chilling requirement, flowering season and ripening season. In the tables 4 and 5 these characters are indicated for each of the 55 described varieties. These characters allow the grower to chose, among the earliest varieties, the most suitable for the warmest regions of our country, where peaches can be obtained about mid may in field and at the beginning of may in protected culture. So it is possible to advance the productive cycle of peach trees. Among the "Extraearly" varieties are then indicated the most promising, in order of earliness, and viz: "Flordasun" and "Flordawon" (only for the mild-winter regions); "Vhynot", "Royal Gold", "Springtime", "Armgold", "Springold" (more suitable for the Central-Northern regions); "Favorita I Morettini", "Merrill May Lady" and "Earlybelle", to grow in the warmest Italian regions. Among the "Very early" varieties are indicated the following: "Favorita II Morettini", "Merrill Bonjour". "Springerest", "Favorita III Morettini", "Desertgold", "Collins", "Merrill Gemfree I", "June Gold ", (only in the most suitable milieux). Since the milieux are very different in Southern Italy and in the Isles, before of adopting a variety for a new commercial peach orchard it is better to try it, particularly for the varieties having a very early flowering season.
42877702|In questa nota l'Autore esamina il ruolo della temperatura sul processo produttivo degli Agrumi. Le ricerche sono state condotte su piante di agrumi della cv. " Tarocco ", allevate in contenitori, sistemate in celle climatiche e divise in tre tesi con temperature di + 12C per 1.440 ore (A); + 5C per 720 ore (B) e + 5C per 1.440 ore (C) a partire dal 20 dicembre. L'Autore conclude affermando che temperature inferiori a + 12C, sebbene determinino una minore emissione di fiori, fanno diminuire notevolmente la percentuale di cascola per cui le piante tenute a + 5C per 720 e 1.440 ore hanno dato una maggiore produzione di quelle tenute a + 12C per 1.440 ore. In this paper the Author examines the role of winter temperatures on the productiveness of the orange trees. The researches carried out with the experimental plan successively described on four years old " Tarocco " variety cultivated in containers. Thesis A: continuous temperature of + 12C for 1.440 hours starting from december 20th; Thesis B: continuous temperature of + 5C for 720 hours starting from december 20th; Thesis C: continuous temperature of + 5C for 1.440 hours starting from december 20th. Every thesis contained five trees that, concluded the period of permanence in climatic cell, were moved in the open air, in normal conditions. The results of the research above mentioned enhance: 1) the allegation percentage was higher in two theses where the trees were kept under temperature of + 5C than those submitted for 1.440 hours under temperature of + 12C; 2) the blossom drop percentage was lower for the trees exposed at the temperature of +5C and such percentage is reduced with the rise of the permanence in the thermic value above mentioned; it was of 12,5% in the thesis B (720 hours at +5C) and of 4,54% in the thesis C (1.440 hours at +5C) indeed. Much more high and namely egual to 65% was the blossom drop for the trees kept at +12C for 1.440 hours (thesis A); 3) the entity of the production was therefore higher in the trees kept at +5C for 720 hours and, in way much more sensible, than those kept at same temperature for a period of 1.440 hours.
42877703|Researches done in 1968-1969 have ascertained that the pollen of some entomophilous species (such as apple, pear and cherry) was carried by the wind to relatively high distances from trees. However it was not yet ascertained whether the air borne pollen was also able to germinate and to fertilize. During 1969-1970 this particular problem has been studied in the apple (cv. " Golden Delicious ") by the following observations: a) comparison of the setting of flowers emasculated before the anthesis and isolated in plastic net bags, with the setting of flowers left to the free pollination; b) comparison of the setting of flowers artificially pollinated by  contact  with the setting of flowers pollinated by  dropping . Both pollination methods have been carried out with pollen of "Jonathan". Pollination by  contact  has been carried out by rubbing the stigmas with a bee strewn with "Jonathan" pollen. Pollination by  dropping  was instead effected by dropping pollen grains over the stigmas of the flowers; c) comparison of the growth of the pollen tubes in the pistil of flowers pollinated either by  contact  or by  dropping , and either in the orchard or in the laboratory. The results of the researches have shown that: 1) the presence of pollen in the air is not a sufficient condition to ensure fertilization. In fact branchlets isolated by plastic nets have produced only parthenocarpic fruits or no fruits at all; 2) the setting of flowers pollinated by  contact  was significantly higher (10.58%) than the setting of flowers pollinated by  dropping  (5.41%); 3) the speed of growth of the pollen tubes was slower in the pistils pollinated by  dropping , than in those pollinated by  contact . It is not easy to single out the causes that have determined this slower growth. It may be presumed, first of all, that a quantity of pollen fallen on the stigma of flowers pollinated by  dropping  was lesser that the quantity received by the stigmas pollinated by  contact . It may also be presumed that this fact has determined a lesser  population effect , with a consequent reduction of the ability to germinate and of the speed growth of the pollen tubes. It is furthermore probable that in flowers pollinated by  dropping  the pollen grains came to a less intimate contact with the surface of the stigma and this fact has reduced their germination ability and also the speed growth of their tubes. The almost total absence of setting of the flowers, which were isolated in net bags, might be ascribed, at least in part, to the same causes assumed to explain the lesser setting of flowers artificially pollinated by  dropping  compared with those pollinated by  contact .
42877704|Piante di Acer palmatum Thumb., coltivate in ville della collina di Torino e di Rivoli (TO), sono state colpite da disseccamento. Dai tessuti vasali necrosati dei rametti  stato isolato un fungo che, per i suoi caratteri morfologici,  stato classificato per Verticillium dahliae Kleb., di cui  stata accertata la patogenicit. Le prove di lotta, attuate con Biomicina + 8 allo 0,02%), Benlate (allo 0,06%), Chinosan (allo 0,1)%, hanno dato risultati altamente significativi rispetto al Testimone. Biomicina +8 e Benlate sono apparsi i pi efficaci contro la verticilliosi dell'Acer palmatum Thumb. During the 1970 Summer some plants of Acer palmatum Thumberg showed twig wilting, with evident darkening of the lower leaf edge and folding toward the upper side. The wilted twig cortical tissues, when observed under the microscope, showed a greyishviolet colour, clearly different from the normal ones, which are green. Inside the xylem tissued showed a dark circular colouring due to the presence of gummy matters, of tilli and fungal mycelium. From these tissues fragments were taken off and placed on agar-carrot-glucosate (pH= 6,5); a hyaline, granular, sectate as verticillium, mycelium, with two or four phyalides bearing conidia also hyalines, unicellular, ovoidal measuring as an average 1,5-3x3,5 -5 micron. On the base of the morphological characters this fungus has been recognized as Verticillium dahliae Kleb. The pathogenicity tests have shown that the fungus, in the inoculated plants has reproduced the same disease already observed in the cultivated plants. It has been observed that the fungus exhibits a pathogenic activity very slow and sometimes no activity at all through the healty cortical tissues, while it is very rapid in presence of wounds produced by meteoric agents, or soil labours and insects. In order to inhibit the infection spreading, we have made test of comparative control, according to the randomization method, with following procedures:  Biomycin + 8 (Polyantibiotics + 8-oxichinoline sulphate) at the dose of 0,02%;  Benlate (50 + acid 1 (butil-carbamoil - 2-benzimidazol carbamic) at the dose of 0,06%;  Chinosan (80% ortho-oxichinoline sulphate) at the dose of 0,1%;  Control: no treatment. The products have been sprinkled on the plants, with frequency of three weekly applications. The results obtained (shown on table n. 1) indicate that the three products have statistically controlled, with reference to the control, the pathogen activity of V. dahliae. Byomicine + 8, especially, was most effective against the pathogen; Benlate has shown a slightly lower effectiveness. However both products, in comparison to Chinosan, have given the best results in the control of V. dahliae Kleb. infections in the Acer palmatum Thumberg plants.

Results of a trial upon the variation of Vitamina C content in tomato fruits during the harvesting period are referred. The cultivars "Patio", "Piertarum", "Marmande V 19", "Marmande Superprecoce SAIS", and the hybrids F "Patio  Piertarum", "Patio  Marmande V 19", "N. 6427" are sowing at 19-1-70 and transplanted in plastichouse (PVC) at 5-3-70. The analyses are conducted on samples of tomato fruits at the stage of colour changes from green to red, with the 2- 6 diclorphenolindophenol titration method. The analyses are carried-out weekly from the beginning to the end of harvesting. The content of Vitamina C changes during the harvesting period, from minimum 15,7 mgr 100 gr fr.s. to maximum 31,9 mgr. The lowest values are found at the beginning of production in the first truss, and the highest values at the end of production in the last truss. This variation in Vitamina C level is greater in hybrids F than in the cultivars. However it is confirmed the heterosis for Vitamina C contents in "Marmande V 19  Patio" hybrid, noted in a previous trial. This heterosis effect results in fruits of 3-4  and following trusses. An other serial analysis has regarded the variation of level Vitamina C during the fruits ripening. In this case the content of Vitamina C increases from green to red stage, decreases from red to deep red stage. This variation is important for sampling and for alimentation.
42877706|In esperimenti condotti per due anni consecutivi sul melone " Charentais " in coltura forzata in serra si sono provati diversi sistemi di allevamento e diverse distanze di impianto. Agli investimenti maggiori (fino a 7,4 piante per metro quadrato) si ottennero le maggiori produzioni per unit di superfice, nonostante diminuisse la produttivit delle singole piante. La cimatura del ramo primario, in serra, ritarda la produzione e ne riduce l'entit; se alla cimatura segue l'allevamento di due rami anzich di uno solo, per si ha un aumento della produzione (non della precocit), purch le piante siano sufficientemente illuminate. Anche nelle prove condotte in coltura semiforzata a terra,  risultato che la cimatura, nella cv. "Charentais ", non porta n ad un anticipo della produzione, n ad una maggiore produttivit. Experiments were carried on in 1968 and 1969, growing muskmelon cv. "Charentais "in hot house with the string method. 1968 trials were directed to study pruning methods and spacing between plants, in relation to production and earliness of plants and best exploitation of covered space. Three pruning treatments were tried: (I) No pruning of primary stem; (II) stopping primary stem at two leaves and growing one secondary stem as main stem; (III) stopping primary stem at two leaves and growing two secondary stems as main stems. Main stems were trained up strings; lateral shoots with perfect flowers were stopped two leaves above the fruitlet, and those without perfect flowers were stopped at one leaf. Pruning treatments were combined with four spacing treatments: a) ternate rows (5 plants /sq. m); b) coupled rows (3,3 plants /sq. m); c) single rows with plants at 50 cm in the row (2 plants /sq. m); d) single rows with plants at 30 cm in the row (3,3 plants /sq. m). The two stems of treatment III were either grown as a V or as a lattice-work. At wider spacings number of fruits per square meter decreaesed and increased number of fruits per plant; production of treatment I was 20% greater than that of treatment II; production of treatment III was greatly affected by plant disposition: lattice-work grown plants produced less than V-grown ones, probably because the first ones shaded each other. Maximum early yield per square meter (see graphs 1-5) was obtained training the primary stem as the main stem. Stopping the primary stem, followed by training two secondarystems delayed but increased production, stopping the plants followed by training one secondary stem both delayed and reduced yield. No difference in earliness was found between lattice-work grown and V-grown plants in single row treatments (treatment n. 10 and n. 11, graph 4); earliness was not even significantly affected by number of plants per square meter. Different treatments strongly affected number of hermafroditic flowers and seemed to affect their position on the stem (graph 6-8). In the year 1969, only the two pruning treatments that had given the best results were tried (no stopping of primary stem and stopping primary stem followed by training two secondary stems as main stems), and a wider range of spacing was tested: from 7,4 to 2,2 plants per square meter. It was confirmed that cropping was closely related to plant spacing: at narrower spacings yield of each plant was depressed, but the increase of production due to greater number of plants per sq. m generally was much larger than the decrease of single plant production. To obtain a high density of plants, it is better to plant at narrow spacings in the row than between rows, to avoid shading. Plants grown with two main stems produced twice as much than plants grown with the primary stem at the same spacing, but early yield was remarkably depressed by stopping the primary stem. Orientative experiments on commercial cultures of muskmelon cultivar "Charentais " on the ground forced in hot beds and under plastic tunnels, showed that stopping the plants affects neither the early nor the total yield.

42877663|Le indagini sono state condotte allo scopo di accertare se allo specifico grado di resistenza al freddo invernale caratteristico delle diverse cultivar di pesco corrispondevano variazioni cronologiche quantitative e qualitative nel contenuto degli idrati di carbonio presenti nelle gemme a fiore. Questi zuccheri, principalmente rappresentati da glucosio e fruttosio, aumentano progressivamente durante tutto Tin verno anche se le temperature si mantengono relativamente miti. Fruit buds of four peach varieties  " Cotogna Massima ",  Vivian ", " Campiel "and " Experimental 1 "  were compared biochemically. The cold hardiness degree is very high in the first two varieties and low in the two latter. The analyses were made in order to attend the content of total sugars and starch during the winter and to identify the sugars by thin-layer chromatography. The results indicate a significant correlation between the hardiness degree and sugars content,  specifically glucose and fructose  which increases during the winter even if the temperature keeps relatively mild (Figgs. 1 and 2). In this way evidence exists that cold hardiness depends on the specific gentical pattern of the different varieties rather than on the winter climatic conditions.

II Captan (gr 250/hl)  risultato assai meno efficace, probabilmente per una minore persistenza o scarsa distribuzione del film funghicida sui frutti. These treatment were applied: 1) at blossom season, 2) at the end of blossom, 3) at the beginning of fruit ripening, at weekly intervals or at intervals of 8-10 days. Phytosanitary observations of each plot were effected for each treatment and at harvest time of the fruits in their respective environments. The test results, as shown in Table 1, have indicated trat Benlate has a specific activity against Botrytis cinerea Pers. of Strawberry. In particular we can observe that in the two crop environments, Benlate at the dose of 60 gr/hl was significatively more effective that at 45 gr/hl. Captan (25 gr/hl) was much less effective, probably owing to its shorter persistence or too little distribution of the fungicid film on the fruits. Application of Captan at 25 gr/hl and of Benlate at 45 gr/hl shold be effected at weekly intervals. Only Benlate at 60 gr/hl allows to obtain the best results, inasmuch as its active principle, both in greenhaouse and in field, as a continuous, homogenous film, in more persistent and performs a better defense on the fruits which are tasty, healthy and will preservable.

42877666|In un vivaio di astoni di melo " Golden delicious " e " Stark delicious "  stata condotta una prova di defogliazione con trattamenti a base di -alanina + KI a dose intera (1% + 0,3%) e dimezzata, con e senza aggiunta di DMSO allo 0,5%. L'andamento della prova mette sinteticamente in rilievo che il DMSO da solo non ha alcuna efficacia defogliante e che aggiunto al trattamento con -alanina + KI a dose intera non ne modifica sostanzialmente le capacit defoglianti. Per contro la sua aggiunta al trattamento a dosi dimezzate ne migliora l'effetto defogliante anche se si ottiene una defogliazione equivalente a quella provocata da -alanina + KI a dose intera con un ritardo di circa 10-15 giorni. Fruit plants, as well as grapes and ornamental species, need to be defoliated when early taken out from nursery soil; for this purpose -alanine and KI treatment have been proposed. A trial has been carried out on " Golden delicious " and " Stark delicious " plants grown for one year in nursery applying these chemicals. Taking into account DMSO's properties, a treatment has been deviced with DMSO on its own and together with -alanine + KI, both at full strength and halved, aiming to check whether such association could be more efficient and economic, or not. It has been observed that DMSO on its own is not effective at all as a defoliant, while added to -alanine + KI full strength (1% + 0,3% respectively) it does not clearly affect their activity. On the contrary when DMSO is added to half dose theatment of -alanine + KI (0,5% + 0,15%) it enhances the effectiveness of the spray, giving results comparable with those from -alanine + KI full strength without DMSO; the only remarkable difference is in the rate of defoliation, which comes to be almost 10-15 days slowered. It can be concluded that adding DMSO allows lighter doses of amynoacid and KI to be used, so reducing the cost of the treatment.

42877711|In recent years new planting systems have been developed, especially for apple culture, in wich the number of trees per ha has risen from a few hundreds to some thousands. A high number of trees per ha, made possible by reducing the planting distances and using dyarfing rootstocks, has many advantages, among which the most important are the following: a) early and high production of fruit per ha, wich is a prerequisite for a higher land use efficiency; b) better light utilization by the tree canopies, which leads to a better fruit quality; c) easier and faster pruning and fruit harvesting, which can be carried out from the ground, without ladders. The results of the intensive planting systems depend on the solution of some tecnical and economical problems, the most important of which concern the varieties, the rootstocks, the control of the tree size, the training systems, the yield-density relationship, the pattern of planting (single or double rows, bed-system), the cost for establishing the orchard, with particular reference to the planting material. By solving such problems particular attention must be payed to the environmental conditions, wich can affect the growth vigour and the fruiting ability of the trees.
42877712|Il processo di meccanizzazione che ha ormai conquistato quasi tutti i settori della tecnica frutticola sta interessando sempre maggiormente anche la potatura. Questa operazione, che incide sensibilmente sul costo di produzione della frutta, ha infatti subito, nell'ultimo decennio, una graduale evoluzione nel senso che da una potatura completamente manuale si  gi passati alla cosiddetta potatura integrata per giungere fino alla potatura meccanica, nella quale cio il lavoro manuale viene quasi totalmente sostituito dall'intervento' delle macchine. L'A. dopo aver illustrato i motivi che hanno determinato la diffusione della potatura meccanica in numerose zone frutticole degli Stati Uniti e pi recentemente anche in Israele, passa a descrivere le macchine con le quali essa viene attuata, le modalit, i tempi ed i costi di esecuzione, nonch le eventuali reazioni negative della pianta a questo particolare tipo di intervento cesorio. Pur senza rinunciare alle fondamentali direttive oggi seguite, l'A. conclude richiamando l'attenzione dei tecnici e dei frutticoitori affinch vengano tenuti presenti tutti quegli accorgimenti che potrebbero dimostrarsi preziosi nella eventualit che una potatura meccanica venga a rendersi indispensabile anche nel nostro Paese. The process of mechanization that has conquered almost all sectors within the fruitculture tecnique is becoming more connected with the pruning process. This operation, which makes a significant effect on the cost of fruit production, is at present carried out exclusively by hand. Recently, other mechanical techniques have been developed such as platforms equiped with power pruners. If it is true that the adoption of such mechanisms has brought a reduction in labor costs (as a share of the total costs of production) and a reduction in pruning costs, it is also true that the mechanization of this operation has much wider objectives and in some cases it has attained results worthy of consideration. Very interesting results has been obtained in the U.S. where, in many areas of fruit production this operation has now been almost fully mechanized. In fact, for more than ten years evergreen/and deciduous fruit trees, trained in the usually way or in hedge  rows have been pruned with sickle bar or sow bar propelled by a tractor or a special self  propelled machine. It regards, obviously, of pruning techniques that tend to standardize to the maximum this operation, applied not because of technical requirements in the productive process, but in order to obtain more economic results. Therefore, with the American experience and after having explained the reason for the adoption of a full mechanized pruning process, the Author comes to describe the various machines with which this mechanization has been achieved and the modality, time and costs of execution, and the eventual negative reactions of the trees to this particular type of pruning. Without renouncing the fundamental methods followed today, the Author concludes asking for the attention of pomology technicians and fruit-growers for the eventual adoption of this mechanical device for pruning if this becomes necessary in our country.

"Chehalis", "Ozark Gold", ecc). Fra le cultivar pi tardive solo la "Granny Smith" sembra avere qualche possibilit di espansione, affiancandosi cos alla stessa "Golden Delicious". Al momento nessuna nuova cultivar sembra ppter essere in grado di sostituire le vecchie e tuttora valide "William", "Abate Ftel", "Kaiser", "Decana del Comizio", "Passa Crassana" ecc.  probabile tuttavia che qualche cultivar, ancora poco diffusa, come ad es. la "Conference", la "Packham's Triumph" e la "Decana d'inverno" accresca la propria importanza. Infine nel settore peschicolo occorre anzitutto registrare l'elevato numero di cultivar di origine specialmente americana, che ogni anno viene introdotto e diffuso dai vivaisti, e che va ad accrescere il gi eterogeneo standard produttivo di questa specie, le cui tendenze possono, nel complesso, essere cos sintetizzate: 1) Si riscontra una crescente espansione delle cultivar a polpa gialla, che nello scorso anno hanno costituito il 63% della produzione. Le pesche bianche, tuttavia,  anche per le loro inconfondibili caratteristiche organolettiche  sono ancora apprezzate dal mercato, purch corrispondenti ad un elevato standard qualitativo. 2) La maggior parte della produzione  concentrata nel mese di luglio ed ni parte di agosto e proviene (per oltre il 65%) dalle regioni settentrionali. 3) Un rilevante interesse colturale viene ora risposto sulle nuove pesche gialle precocissime (es. "Armgold", "Springold", "Springerest", "Earlired", ecc.) e su quelle che maturano dopo la "Redhaven" ("Redtop", "Glohaven", "Suncrest", "Cresthaven", ecc). Il primo gruppo  importante per le regioni centro meridionali ed il secondo per quelle settentrionali, dove asseconda due due differenti orientamenti produttivi che sono parzialmente complementari e corrispondono alla vocazione delle rispettive aree territoriali. 4) Molte nuove nettarine sono state da poco introdotte in Italia. Poich i prezzi finora spuntati dalle prime produzioni ottenute sono risultati assai alti, molti peschicoltori stanno estendendo tale coltura senza avere una sufficiente conoscenza sul loro comportamento e sulle future capacit di assorbimento dei mercati. 5) Per vari motivi  ancora assai scarsa l'importanza della coltivazione delle pesche da industria, ma recentemente c' stato un risveglio di interesse per questo tipo di pesche, favorito pure esso, dall'introduzione delle percoche americane. The Author points out the situation and the development trend of the apple, pear and peach crops in Italy, with special reference to the varieties. In the last years there was a high surplus of all these kinds of fruits but specially of pears (600,000 tons of pear crop have been withdrawn from the market during 1970); as a consequence some thousand of acres of orchard were pulled out during the last winter in the Po Valley region. So it is very important to eliminate the old poor varieties and to improve the quality of the valuable crop. In Italy the per-capite consumption is already very high for the fresh market fruits, but instead is very low for the processed fruits. In the next ten years these latters should increase proportionally more than the firsts. The biggest market troubles involve more the apple and pears than the peaches. Concerning the apple topic only "Golden Delicious" and "Jonathan" increased in the last 10 years; others, like "Red Delicious" (and its sports), and "Rome Beauty" (and its sports) appear stationary. Most of the winter varieties (like "Abbondanza", "Winesap", etc.) decreased very much their importance. The great hopes are now set overall on the "Delicious spur" varieties although it seems these don't improve the standard flavour of the "Red Delicious". Perhaps the "Golden spur" sports show more disadvantages. Also the newest "Golden-like" varieties ("Primegold", "Mutsu", "Sungold", etc.) have been tried since some years for their resistance to russeting and because some of them advance the "Golden" season maturity (e.g. Chehalis, "Ozark Gold", etc.). Among the latest apple varieties, only "Granny Smith" has gained a lot of favours for the high prices obtained on the North European markets. Concerning the pear varieties there are very few possibility to introduce new strains, because the old varieties ("Bartlett", "Passa Crassana", "Cornice", "Beurr Bosh", Abb Ftel) are yet the best. May be, Conference and Packham's Triumph will spread in the next future. It doesn't say the same for the peaches which every year add new american and Italian varieties to the others grown. The outline of the peaches situation can be summarized as follows: 1) The yellow freestone peaches grew up last year to the 63% of total amount of peach crop. 2) The white varieties are again appreciate only if they show a superior standard quality. 3) The most part of the crop ripens in July and August (Cardinal, Dixired, Redhaven, "Hale" etc.) and come from North of Italy. Great interest now is placed on the early varieties (Armgold, Springold, Springerest, Merrill Gem Free, Earlired, etc.) and on the middle-season varieties, which ripen after Redhaven ("Redtop", "Glohaven", "Suncrest", "Cresthaven", etc.). The first group is important for the South and the Middle Italy and the latter for the North of Italy, where is concentrated more than 65% of the total amount of the peach crops. 4) A lot of new Nectarines have been recently introduced in the North and in the South of Italy. Since the price of the first crops have been higher than that of normal peaches, many growers wish to extend this kind of peaches, but there is not enough experience and knowledge about the behaviour of these varieties and their future results on the European markets. 5) For other reasons the clingstone peaches industry has still now very poor importance in Italy.
42877714|Yield, trunk diameter, weight of pruning, size of fruits, and labour requirement for pruning and harvesting from Butirra Precoce Morettini trees were recorded for 5 years in established palmettes. Some trees were grafted on quince, spaced at 2.53.5 m, and some others were grafted on seedling, spaced at 4.04.5 m. All trees were pruned by thinning the 1-year-old laterals but in both rootstocks some trees had cutted back the main shoots (variant A) and in some others did not (variant B). The results show that in established trees in no case the yield and growth have been changed by the method of pruning. Instead greater was the rootstocks influence concerning either yield or growth: actually the trees grafed on quince had less development as compared with the trees grafed on seedling. This dwarfness allows to plant more trees per hectar; consequently, the yield is greater for the trees grafed on quince, in spite of the lake of influence of the rootstocks on the yield. Pruning labour per hectar was greater with the trees grafed on quince, owing to the greater planting density; instead, the time required for harvesting was more in the trees grafted on seedling. There was no significant difference in fruits size.

Grass mulch is frequently applied in some fruit areas of the northern sides of Italy and the north Europe. Grass mulched soils are not cultivated, the grass being frequently cut down without removing it from the orchard. The A. gives a short account of results of some experimental researches carried out in grass-mulched and clean cultivated orchards with special relation to the following effects of grassing down: a) soil physical caracteristics; b) moisture competition; c) nutritrion, growth and fruit set of trees and caracteristics of fruits. The A. concludes suggesting that grassing down is profitably allowed by a naturally hight soil moisture content or by irrigation.
42878554|Gli AA. studiano gli effetti dell'Ethrel, della GA e dell'Alar sull'espressione sessuale, sullo sviluppo vegetativo, sulla produzione, sulla precocit e sulla forma dei frutti del melone cv. "Charentais" (andromonoica). Le sostanze sono state tutte usate a 4 livelli di principio attivo e cio 0, 150, 300, 600 p.p.m. per l'Ethrel, 0, 25, 50, 100 p.p.m. per la GA e 0, 750, 1500, 3000 p.p.m. per l'Alar ed irrorate due volte a 1-2 e 3-4 foglie vere. L'Ethrel modifica profondamente l'espressione sessuale agendo non solo come  femminilizzante , ma anche come  demascolinizzante : la sostanza esprime una diversa intensit di azione sui due tipi di fiori e sull'abbassamento del nodo di comparsa del primo fiore ermafrodita sull'asse primario secondo la concentrazione usata ed egualmente esprime un pi o meno intenso effetto brachizzante ed un effetto nullo o vistoso sulla forma dei frutti. La GA manifesta alle dosi pi alte un leggero effetto mascolinizzante, un effetto positivo sulla produzione, mentre non modifica lo sviluppo delle piante e la forma dei frutti. L'Alar non varia in modo apprezzabile l'espressione sessuale, riduce leggermente la produzione, non modifica la forma dei frutti e provoca una notevole brachizzazione soprattutto alle dosi pi alte. Ethrel, Gibberellin A and Alar effects on sex expression, growth, yield, earliness and shape of muskmelon cv. "Charentais". (1st part). Ethrel, GA and Alar effects on sex expression, growth development, yield, earliness and shape of muskmelon cv. "Charentais" (andromonoecious) were studied. Chemical were used at the following four concentrations on active material basis: Ethrel 0, 150, 300, 600 p.p.m.; GA 0, 25, 50, 100 p.p.m.; Alar 0, 750, 1500, 3000 p.p.m. and twice sprayed at 1-2 and 3-4 true leaves. Ethrel strongly modifies sex expression both increasing production of hermafrodite flowers and decreasing male flowers. It strongly acts on the lowering of the node number of the first hermafrodite flower on the main stem and delays the appereance of the male flowers: the evidence of the first effect is bigger at lower concentration, the opposite for the second effect. For a substantial femaleness a 150 p.p.m. level (on active material basis) may be used; for a certain period inhibition of male flowers appearance a 600 p.p.m. level will be necessary. Practically two sprayes of 600 p.p.m. delay more than one month the appearance of the first male flower. Ethrel may be therefore used as a strong gametocide for muskmelon. Ethrel modifies the morphological aspect of the plant: it removes the apical dominance and causes the shortening of the internodes. Fruit deformation due to progressive transversal diameter reduction and contemporary longitudinal diameter increase results at higher concentrations. Average fruit weight does not change. GA slightly modifies sex expression: at the higher concentrations increases the number of male flowers and the fruit production. It has no effect on growth development of the stem and on fruit shape, but it retards of about two days the picking time. GA don't neutralize neither reduce Ethrel femaleness and Alar retardation of stem growth. Alar has no significant effect on sex expression: ratio hermafrodite/male flowers does not change because a slight reduction of the number of both is obtained. It gives a slight advance in hermafrodite flowering and a small delay in male one. Alar gives a strong retardation of stem growth: higher percentage reduction can be seen in the lower internodes with highest concentrations. It slightly decreases the yield, slightly delays the picking maturity of fruits and does not affect the fruit shape.
